Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are

Quantion is a Business Digital Transformation services company born in 2015.

Our services are based on a Digital Factory model. Through this model we help companies to accelerate its digital transformation projects with an end-to-end approach.




We have +120 professionals in application development, UX/UI and digital business transformation to build innovative solutions oriented to business results.




As a Digital Factory we combine our teams in cutting-edge technologies and digital deep experiences with the innovation ecosystem, to ensure that we can provide the best solution to face business challenges, from its concept to its implementation.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Technology team. If you want to participate in one of our biggest International projects, don’t hesitate to apply!




What you will do:

You will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining data collection architecture, reports, metrics and analyses for different teams
You will juggling all kinds of data, collect and analyze them and seek for patterns and trends to drive the digital acceleration and future customer experience
You will utilize big data and business intelligence technologies to shape and drive key business decisions.
You'll make analysis results accessible by building and providing dashboards and reports based on business needs
You closely align with business and management teams to assess business needs
You collaborate with the product teams to identify possibilities for improvement and adaptations regarding their digital products
You will work pragmatically and support my team to deliver high quality solutions with speed
You will work in an international environment with a diverse team
You will work in an international environment with a highly diverse team




Required skills:

At least 2 years of experience as a Digital Analyst
Experience in working in cross-functional teams in an agile environment
Knowledge of software-development processes, dependencies and digital products as well as methodologies and frameworks like Scrum and Kanban
Knowledge of databases (e.g., SQL, NoSQL…), reporting tools (e.g. , Tableau) and cloud platforms (esp. Microsoft Azure)
Ambition to master and not being intimidated by unstructured data and large datasets
Willingness to expand my comfort zone by sometimes leaving it
Very good command of English language







Apply to our offer…

💟 If you are passionate about technologies

💟 If you define yourself as a team worker

💟 If you want to work with a multidisciplinary and international team

💟 If you want to be part of a company which is permanently expanding and growing

💟 If you want to work in an international environment




Our offering:

✨ Permanent contract

✨ Competitive salary

✨ 22 days of vacation

✨ 5 additional holidays for Christmas

✨ 4 additional holidays for Easter

✨ Flexible working time

✨ Continuous working days in summer




Committed to equality, at Quantion we believe in diversity and inclusion. We defend equal opportunities without discriminating based on gender, age, religion or sexual orientation or any other aspect that could be considered exclusive.

Title: Data Analyst - Prácticas/Junior (Automoción)
Description:
En BETWEEN te ofrecemos las oportunidades que necesitas para alcanzar tus objetivos profesionales. Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en IT e Ingeniería ¡este es tu próximo destino!

Damos soporte en una gran variedad de áreas como Firmware, Software, BI, Diseño, Project Management y muchas más. Además, desarrollamos soluciones tecnológicas a medida desde nuestros BETWEEN Labs.

Estamos buscando un Data Analyst - Prácticas/Junior (Automoción) para ampliar uno de nuestros equipos en Martorell.

Funciones

Como Data Analyst En Prácticas o Junior, Tendrás La Oportunidad De Involucrarte En Diversas Tareas Clave Dentro Del Departamento De Automoción. Algunas De Las Funciones Que Realizarás Incluyen


Aprenderás a automatizar los procesos de flujo de datos
Colaborar en la recopilación, análisis y visualización de datos utilizando herramientas como Python y Power BI para generar reportes que faciliten la toma de decisiones.
Apoyar en la elaboración de informes y dashboards que contribuyan a la optimización de procesos dentro del sector automotriz.
Participar en el diseño y la implementación de estrategias de análisis de datos que permitan identificar tendencias y oportunidades de mejora en los proyectos.
Asistir en la interpretación de los datos y presentar hallazgos y recomendaciones al equipo para su implementación.
Trabajar en colaboración con diferentes equipos técnicos y de gestión para asegurar la coherencia y calidad en el análisis de datos.


Beneficios

En BETWEEN Valoramos a Nuestros Empleados y Nos Aseguramos De Ofrecerles Un Entorno De Trabajo Que Favorezca Su Desarrollo y Bienestar. Entre Los Beneficios Que Ofrecemos Se Encuentran


Seguro médico con Sanitas para cuidar de tu salud y bienestar.
Oportunidades de formación en idiomas, certificaciones, bootcamps y mucho más, para potenciar tus habilidades y conocimientos.
Acceso a multitud de eventos que fomentan la camaradería y la diversión, como BETWEEN Night, Torneo de Padel, Black Mamba Race y mucho más.
Retribución flexible que incluye opciones como ticket restaurant, transporte y guardería, para adaptarse a tus necesidades.
Incentivos por recomendar talento, porque sabemos que el mejor equipo se construye a través de conexiones valiosas.


Si estás buscando una oportunidad para iniciar tu carrera en el campo del análisis de datos y deseas formar parte de un equipo innovador en el sector de la automoción, ¡esperamos contar contigo! La pasión por los datos y el deseo de aprender son fundamentales en este rol. Puedes ser la persona clave que nos ayude a transformar información en decisiones estratégicas y valiosas. Juntos, podemos llevar la tecnología a un nuevo nivel en el ámbito automotriz.

Requisitos


Tener la oportunidad de realizar convenio de practicas con tu centro de estudios o haber finalizado recientemente un grado académico y querer realizar un contrato formativo en prácticas.
Ganas de aprender y motivación para iniciar una profesión,
Show more

La pasión por los datos y el deseo de aprender son fundamentales en este rol. Puedes ser la persona clave que nos ayude a transformar información en decisiones estratégicas y valiosas. Juntos, podemos llevar la tecnología a un nuevo nivel en el ámbito automotriz.

Requisitos

  • Tener la oportunidad de realizar convenio de practicas con tu centro de estudios o haber finalizado recientemente un grado académico y querer realizar un contrato formativo en prácticas.
  • Ganas de aprender y motivación para iniciar una profesión,

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst Intern with experience in Python, SQL, analytics and knowledge of statistics to join our team in Barcelona. Working alongside our Data Engineers, the candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform! 

This is a 6 month full-time internship based in Barcelona!

Your tasks and responsibilities:

Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to address strategic questions
Obtain and Report insights from our Product´s performance (ML, Audiences, Creatives, Supply, etc) in order to make decisions that will impact revenue.  Have one´s say!
Develop automated dashboards and processes to ensure data influence decisions at all levels of the company
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance

Skills and requirements:

Knowledge of Python, SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Engineering or Business
Knowledge of basic statistics concepts
Analytical skills with the ability to get insights
Outstanding communication and reporting skills
Excellent command of Microsoft Excel (Power Pivot & Power Query) 
Excellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatory
Strong experience with SQL for data exploratory analysis
Experience with A/B testing
R, Superset, PowerBI experience is a plus
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus.

Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:

Integrate a highly motivated and young team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbeque, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - Ticket Restaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 28 countries
And more!
Show more

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
Global Master Data Analyst

Global Master Data Analyst would be part of a team, in charge of code creation process, running enrichment processes and maintenance of master data for Coty worldwide on a global SAP platform.

Responsibilities

You would be responsible for ensuring that the Material Master Data is created on time and accurate as per briefing from Marketing/Initiative Leader. You are following the Global Data Standards provided by our Data Governance Team and contributing to adjust them to changing needs. As Coty’s growth builds on constant new product developments, this position plays a key role delivering “Data Readiness” during different stages of the Innovation and leading the work across.

Your main focus:


Deliver Key Performance Indicators, making sure to reach the Service Level Agreement targets.
Understanding of the product creation cycles and basic data, whilst understanding the business impacts.
Identify systemic errors and trend analysis, being able to root cause, sharing a clear issue statement.
Tracking all new project status, with direct contact and communication across different workstreams, to guarantee the visibility and status of data readiness in SAP for all new initiative in the scope, giving priority based on business requirements.
Follow up with departments involved with Master Data functionality reporting clear issue statement, tackling business needs with clarity and structure.


Working for Coty means being part of one of the largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skin care and body care. We are a global leader in fragrance and number three in color cosmetics and our products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. COTY and its brands are committed to a range of social causes, embraces diversity as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment. You can work in a truly international and dynamic work environment, in a culture based on trust and cooperation with opportunities of continues improvement and learning with the freedom to be yourself.

The team consists today of five Master Data Analyst. You will work closely together with several departments such as Master Data Governance, Initiative leaders, Marketing, Planning, R&D, Quality and IT. All your colleagues are dedicated experts and ready to drive Coty to the next level. Working with a team environment with can do attitude, optimistic, focus on finding solutions. The team has a continuous improvement mindset, committed to resolving upcoming challenges and opportunities, to make processes more efficient. Master data community main characteristics are team spirit, collaboration and working together cohesively toward common goals. They willingly share knowledge and resources, help when needed, and celebrate each other's successes.

YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You like to focus on the results and be able to react to the business’s need with sensibility. As a/an experienced Master Data Analyst, you collaborate and work together with other teams, and you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and international environment.

Other than that, you:


Bachelor’s degree (Engineering, BA and/or similar academic background).
Good technical skills in Excel and SAP. Knowledge in Microsoft Access, Visual Basic will be considered.
Root Cause Analysis (RCA) mentality, with ability to propose and deliver improvements.
Team Player mindset.
Strong sense of individual accountability – personal drive to improve and passionate ownership of performance.
Autonomous motivation to implement changes and challenge the current process / system to deliver improved results.
Good English level and communication skills.


Our Benefits

As our Master Data Analyst some of the benefits you will receive are:


A salary that matches your knowledge and experience
Omni-Working: Hybrid flexible working model enabling employees to balance remote and office-based work and promote work / life balance.
Flexible working hours
Meal voucher
Medical & Physiotherapy Service


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A telephone/online introductory meeting.
A first online/in-person interview
A second interview
You will receive a proposal with the terms of employment.


About Coty

Coty is one of the world’s largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!
Show more

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
NDT Global is the leading provider of ultra-high-tech diagnostic inspection solutions, advanced data analysis and integrity assessment services for ensuring the safety and longevity of energy-sector infrastructure assets. Recognized as the forerunner in ultrasonic inspection technologies comprising Pulse Echo, Pitch-and-Catch and Phased Array, as well as Acoustic Resonance (ART Scan) methodologies, the company also deploys a range of non-ultrasonic technologies, such as Inertial Measurement Units, with more under development. NDT Global strategically applies its inspection technologies to detect, diagnose and model various types of threat—circumferential or axial cracks, metal loss, geometry, mapping, and more—across diverse classes of assets. By providing predictive, decision-ready insights driven by the world’s most accurate data, NDT Global enables the conditions for asset owners to optimize infrastructure health and drive operational efficiencies while reducing risk and minimizing their carbon footprint.

Purpose

The Data Analyst interprets data collected from Ultrasonic Shear Wave Technology for the purposes of detecting crack-like axial defects under the constant supervision of individuals qualified for the task(s) being performed.

Role And Responsibilities


Identifies and carries-out feature/anomaly recognition of pipeline data (identification, classification, and sizing)
Identifies girth welds, longitudinal seam welds, and spiral welds applicable to the data set
Identifies pipeline installations and appurtenances
Establishes and validates reference points
Identifies wall thickness changes
Correlates, aligns, and ties-in customer maps, logs, alignment sheets or PODs to the data and creates a tally register
Interprets Above Ground Markers (AGM) information – applies, edits, and generates location reference listing for this data



Qualifications And Requirements


Must possess a High School Diploma
An associate degree from a technical college is required
Minimum of 2 year's working experience in a technical field is preferred



Skillset


Proficient in English, both spoken and written
Strong data interpretation and analysis skills
Ability to generate clear and concise reports
Detail-oriented approach to data validation and reference point establishment
Competence in establishing and validating reference points.
Capability to correlate and align customer maps, logs, and alignment sheets with collected data.
Knowledge in interpreting Above Ground Markers (AGM) information and generating location reference listings.



Benefits


Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package: Health Insurance, pension Plan, Gym Flex, eyecare, 23 days Annual leave
Flexible & Hybrid working: Our flextime model allows you to design your working day as it suits your needs
We think about the future: Individual training and development opportunities and professional development schemes
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and make a significant impact on our data strategy
International, intercultural and young working environment.
Great company culture and office environment



At NDT Global, we are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace. We believe that equal opportunities for all employees are essential to our success.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Apply now »

We provide inspiration worldwide with our intelligent solutions for industrial automation. We offer a high degree of flexibility to our more than 20.000 employees. We provide you excellent prospects for turning your ideas into reality – because innovation requires freedom and security. We need you. Apply now and keep the world moving.

Marketing Data Analyst

About FESTO

FESTO is a leading global company in automation technology and technical education. We are committed to driving innovation and providing high-quality products and services to our customers. Our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona is at the forefront of driving data-driven decisions to optimize our sales processes and strategies.

Job Summary

We are seeking motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona to work for Digital Marketing department. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in data analysis, a strong analytical mindset, and the ability to turn data into actionable insights.

Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with the Digital Marketing team to understand data needs and provide analytical support
Lead the collection, cleaning, and analysis of large and complex data sets to support business operations (email campaign, SEA, SEO…).
Develop and maintain advanced reports, dashboards, and visualizations to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and drive business insights.
Develop and present comprehensive data-driven insights and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders.
Utilize task mining tools to analyze workflows and identify inefficiencies, redundancies, and opportunities for automation
Review and oversee tasks performed by junior analysts, ensuring accuracy and quality of work.


Qualifications


Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field. A PhD is a plus.
2+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a sales, marketing or business analytics role.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Advanced knowledge of SQL and experience with large-scale cloud data analysis frameworks
Proficiency in Python and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Ability to extract and translate business metrics and questions from data sets into well-documented and actionable insights.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex data-driven insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Fluent in English; proficiency in Spanish is a plus.


What We Offer


Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work environment.


Company: Festo Automation S.A.U.

Location:

Barcelona, ES, 08908

We look forward to your application!

Apply now »

Title: Ingeniero junior de datos (Gestión flota)
Description:
Descripción de la empresa

Agbar (Veolia) es un líder mundial en la gestión optimizada de recursos, incluyendo agua, energía y residuos. Con una presencia significativa en España, se ha consolidado como un socio estratégico para clientes municipales e industriales, ofreciendo soluciones innovadoras y sostenibles para abordar desafíos medioambientales y climáticos.

Recientemente, se ha ampliado la capacidad de Agbar -Veolia para ofrecer servicios avanzados en el mercado español así como la implementación de tecnologías avanzadas y sostenibles.

Descripción del empleo


Gestión i control de kilómetros y de uso de vehículos.
Coordinación y control de devoluciones de vehículos.
Seguimiento y control de vehículos en talleres y costes de gestión y reparaciones.
Gestión de pedidos de vehículos.
Control facturas de renting.
Control facturas de seguros.
Mejora de las BBDD.


Requisitos


Ingeniería Técnica Industrial, ADE o similar.
Experiencia mínima de 2 años.
Conocimientos técnicos sobre gestión de activos.
Conocimientos en business intelligence, analítica de datos...
Experiencia en gestión de proyectos.


Información adicional

Posibilidad de incorporarte a una empresa líder en servicios medioambientales y sostenible, y a un equipo multidisciplinar.

Incorporación inmediata .Posición estable, contrato indefinido.

Oportunidades de desarrollo y crecimiento profesional dentro del Grupo.

Calendarios que facilitan la conciliación.

Ambiente dinámico.

Retos profesionales.

Flexibilidad horaria.

Programas de retribución flexible.

Como empresa inclusiva, Veolia está comprometida con la diversidad y valora todas las solicitudes sin discriminación.

Como empresa inclusiva, Veolia está comprometida con la diversidad y valora todas las solicitudes sin discriminación.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are 




We simplify wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, we’re here to help people trust themselves enough to build their financial freedom — for now and the future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks*, precious metals and commodities* they want — with any sized budget, 24/7. Our global team works across different cultures and time zones, bringing our products to more than 6 million customers, making us one of Europe’s safest and most secure platforms that powers modern investing.




Headquartered in Austria but operating across Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, “roll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen” kind of people. It’s these diverse perspectives and innovative minds operating as ONE TEAM that keep Bitpanda at the cutting edge of our industry. So if you’re someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let’s go!

 


Your mission


As a Marketing Strategy and Data Analyst at Bitpanda, you will be supporting the Commercial Strategy and Operations team with the completion of day-to-day tasks. These include data analysis and preparation of different campaigns, reporting on performance metrics, and management of ongoing projects.


What you’ll do



Bring together, explore and analyse large-scale datasets to find actionable marketing insights


Provide a better understanding of customers, their user characteristics and how they use our products


Segment and target customers effectively to maximise conversions and relevance of Bitpanda’s marketing campaigns while advancing strategic goals


Collaborate across multiple teams and departments to help support a data-driven marketing team


Create interactive reports and dashboards to solve specific needs and empower key stakeholders, extracting key insights and lessons from post-campaign performance data to shape upcoming product launches and marketing campaigns



Who you are



2+ years of experience in a data analytics or BI role


A data enthusiast who can translate complex topics into simple and actionable insights


Relevant experience in marketing analytics, consumer insights and/or business analysis 


Excellent data querying and visualisation skills. 




Proficiency in SQL, Tableau and Google Sheets is required; 


familiarity with Snowflake and Metabase are strongly preferred. 




Detail orientation, proactivity, strong analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills



What’s in it for you





Hybrid-working model with 25-Work From Anywhere days*


Competitive total compensation package including participation in our stock option plan


Market-leading benefits programs shaped  by our Time & Flexibility policies*


Company-wide and team events — both in-person and virtually!


Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brand





And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda’s incredible journey towards being Europe’s future #1 investment platform.




Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.




* These benefits may be adjusted at Bitpanda’s discretion and do not apply to our internships and exceptions to our Hybrid Working policy apply to teams with shift schedules or for folks whose roles require them to be in-office (think: Workplaces team or IT).

Show more
HTML:
Who we are 


We simplify wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, we’re here to help people trust themselves enough to build their financial freedom — for now and the future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks*, precious metals and commodities* they want — with any sized budget, 24/7. Our global team works across different cultures and time zones, bringing our products to more than 6 million customers, making us one of Europe’s safest and most secure platforms that powers modern investing.


Headquartered in Austria but operating across Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, “roll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen” kind of people. It’s these diverse perspectives and innovative minds operating as ONE TEAM that keep Bitpanda at the cutting edge of our industry. So if you’re someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let’s go!

 


Your mission

As a Marketing Strategy and Data Analyst at Bitpanda, you will be supporting the Commercial Strategy and Operations team with the completion of day-to-day tasks. These include data analysis and preparation of different campaigns, reporting on performance metrics, and management of ongoing projects.


What you’ll do

  • Bring together, explore and analyse large-scale datasets to find actionable marketing insights

  • Provide a better understanding of customers, their user characteristics and how they use our products

  • Segment and target customers effectively to maximise conversions and relevance of Bitpanda’s marketing campaigns while advancing strategic goals

  • Collaborate across multiple teams and departments to help support a data-driven marketing team

  • Create interactive reports and dashboards to solve specific needs and empower key stakeholders, extracting key insights and lessons from post-campaign performance data to shape upcoming product launches and marketing campaigns


Who you are

  • 2+ years of experience in a data analytics or BI role

  • A data enthusiast who can translate complex topics into simple and actionable insights

  • Relevant experience in marketing analytics, consumer insights and/or business analysis 

  • Excellent data querying and visualisation skills. 


    • Proficiency in SQL, Tableau and Google Sheets is required; 

    • familiarity with Snowflake and Metabase are strongly preferred. 


  • Detail orientation, proactivity, strong analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills

What’s in it for you



  • Hybrid-working model with 25-Work From Anywhere days*

  • Competitive total compensation package including participation in our stock option plan

  • Market-leading benefits programs shaped  by our Time & Flexibility policies*

  • Company-wide and team events — both in-person and virtually!

  • Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brand


And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda’s incredible journey towards being Europe’s future #1 investment platform.


Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.


* These benefits may be adjusted at Bitpanda’s discretion and do not apply to our internships and exceptions to our Hybrid Working policy apply to teams with shift schedules or for folks whose roles require them to be in-office (think: Workplaces team or IT).

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Role Purpose

As a Product Analyst, you will join ID Finance to support the development and optimization of the company’s products. You will focus on ensuring the effective operation of the legal and support teams while working to improve customer service processes, making them more data-driven and efficient.




Primary Responsibilities

Design, run, conclude AB tests in Product department.
Perform deep analysis of user metrics to find key points of growth or potential problems in user journeys.
Develop data-marts prototypes and analytical reports with key product indicators.
Automation and setup of analytical tools like appsflyer, google analytics and etc.




Knowledge & Skills

3+ years of relevant experience in similar role of Senior Product analyst in fintech/banking or e-commerce company
Strong background in statistics and AB design and analysis
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably column-oriented DBMS
Experience with google analytics setup or working with similar platform.
Knowledge of modern mobile marketing attribution platforms like appsflyer and etc.
Fluent in English
High attention to detail and ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Proactive, independent, and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced setting.




Nice to have:

Experience with Clickhouse DB
BI instruments like tableau, superset
Experience with airflow




Technological stack:

Clickhouse
Python
Git
Airflow
MySQL
Google cloud, google analytics, firebase
Appsflyer




Benefits

💪 Private health and dental insurance.

👟 Discounted gym membership.

💻 Freedom to work from home two days a week.

🍎 Kitchen with free coffee and fruit each Monday, Wednesday and Friday and snacks.

🌍 Team building activities and work in an international and passionate environment.




Don’t miss the opportunity to be part of a company that values innovation and talent!

Join us and take your career to the next level 🚀

Title: Junior Data Analyst - Commercial Strategy (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

You will be in charge of providing data for the main partner strategies of the Account Management team. Through analytics, you will be globally identifying and improving the experience of the customer in Glovo. You will be a direct contributor to key company initiatives, taking full ownership of data analysis and insight generation, automating data generation together with our Data teams, and driving reporting enhancements, while you will also contribute with recommendations to the initiatives you are part of for global implementation.

THE JOURNEY


Develop and apply analytical frameworks to evaluate partner performance across multiple countries.
Analyze partner behavior and lifecycle patterns and perform root-cause analysis to identify drivers of performance.
Build and run ad-hoc SQL queries to extract relevant data, prepare structured datasets, and support fast-turnaround analyses.
Automate recurring reports and build dashboards or ad-hoc reports to enable self-service access to key commercial metrics.
Calculate and track strategic KPIs such as retention and lifecycle targets, tailored by country and partner segment.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., BI, commercial, data managers) to define analytical priorities, validate insights, and align on actions.
Lead the discovery phase of new analytical topics, shaping hypotheses, structuring analysis, and translating data into clear, actionable insights.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


A degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
1–2 years of experience turning data into actionable insights to support internal decision-making.
Strong analytical skills and solid command of SQL and Excel. Experience with BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI) is a must.
Experience with Python and analytical libraries (Pandas, SciPy, Scikit-learn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks) or R is highly valued.
A strategic mindset with a deep understanding of business impact and prioritization.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to turn complex data into clear recommendations.
Strong organizational and multitasking abilities—you thrive in fast-paced environments and are comfortable managing several projects simultaneously.
A bias for action: you move fast, take ownership, and get things done with a hands-on attitude.
Team spirit and adaptability—you collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and communicate clearly.
Professional level of English (written and spoken).


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our Barcelona office as a Data Scientist / Analyst within the Analytics Performance Marketing team.

You will collaborate closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists, UA Managers and other Marketing roles to analyse and interpret data that drives our marketing strategies.

Your insights will play a key role in shaping campaign optimization, identifying growth opportunities, and ultimately contributing to the company's success in a competitive gaming market.

As a Data Scientist / Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets from a variety of analytical solutions from simple to complex.

Key Responsibilities:
Data Analysis & Reporting:
Gather, clean, and analyze marketing data from multiple sources to provide actionable insights.
Produce ad hoc analyses to support decision-making for campaigns and product launches.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns ( paid ads, organic TV, brand) and provide recommendations for optimisation.
Develop actionable insights from user data that inform marketing targeting, acquisition and retention strategies.
Data Modelling - Time Series forecasting, A/B Testing
Collaboration:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Data Science, Data Engineer, to integrate marketing data with overall product and business objectives.
Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders through clear and concise visualizations and presentations.
Data Quality & Governance:
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all marketing data through regular data audits and validation processes.
Help set and maintain data tracking standards across marketing channels, ensuring consistency and reliability.







What We're Looking For

Required Qualifications:
3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Scientist or in a similar analytical role, preferably within the gaming / tech / financial industry.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python, Excel, etc.).
Experience with data modelling, time series analysis, A/B testing, Difference in Difference
Ability to identify trends, extract insights, and communicate findings in a clear and actionable manner.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Ability to present complex data in an easy-to-understand format to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Familiarity with game-related metrics, mobile apps such as daily active users (DAU), in-app purchases (IAPs), and retention/engagement metrics.


Why Product Madness?

As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino. With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gdańsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day. But don’t just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‘Employer of the Year - Media and Entertainment’ category.

So, what’s stopping you?

Travel Expectations

None

Additional Information

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Title: Data Analyst Junior (Power BI, Media jornada, Sector Industrial)
Description:
Grupo Ribas, PYME ubicada en Sant Esteve Sesrovires y especializada en la fabricación de cajas de cartón, busca incorporar a un estudiante o recién licenciado de Estadística o Matemáticas para el rol de Data Analyst.




El puesto, de nueva creación, forma parte del proceso de digitalización de la empresa y se integrará en el Departamento de Informática.




Las funciones principales incluyen la elaboración de informes en Power BI a partir de datos almacenados en SQL Server, para analizar la producción y apoyar la toma de decisiones.




Se ofrece contrato a media jornada, en un entorno industrial real, con posibilidad de incorporación futura.




Requisitos

Estudiante o recién licenciado de Estadística, Matemáticas o similar.
Se valorará conocimientos en Power BI y SQL (preferiblemente SQL Server).
Capacidad para entender el negocio y comunicar resultados de forma clara.
Ganas de aprender, pensamiento crítico y atención al detalle.
Trabajo en equipo y buena comunicación con distintos perfiles.
Valorable experiencia previa con datos.

Title: Climate Data Analyst - all genders
Description:
Opella is the self-care challenger with the purest and third-largest portfolio in the Over-The-Counter (OTC) & Vitamins, Minerals & Supplements (VMS) market globally.  

Our mission is to bring health in people’s hands by making self-care as simple as it should be. For half a billion consumers worldwide – and counting.

At the core of this mission is our 100 loved brands, our 11,000-strong global team, our 13 best-in-class manufacturing sites and 4 specialized science and innovation development centers. Headquartered in France, Opella is the proud maker of many of the world’s most loved brands, including Allegra, Buscopan, Doliprane, Dulcolax, Enterogermina, Essentiale and Mucosolvan.

B Corp certified in multiple markets, we are active players in the journey towards healthier people and planet. Find out more about our mission at www.opella.com.

About The Job

Opella's promise is to challenge the conventions of care and define a whole new way to think about health – for our people, our communities, and our planet. And we mean our words: Opella is BCorp certified and our Net Zero Target has been submitted to the Science Base Target initiative for approval.

In that context of our net zero transformation, we are looking for a Climate Data Analyst who will play a pivotal role in developing new Data analytics and Data Science techniques to inform decision-making and fuel our Decarbonization roadmap.

In this position, you will report to our NetZero Transformation lead.

The position is based in Barcelona (Spain).

Key Responsibilities

1/ Ensure Carbon data are collected, actionable, governed, scalable and integrated throughout the organization:


Design pragmatic solutions to improve calculation methods from primary systems and develop automated data collection processes and pipelines to ensure timely and accurate acquisition of data, utilizing APIs and database connections.
Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to design and optimize data architectures, storage solutions, and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes for efficient data management and access.
Implement data stewardship and governance to maintain data integrity, consistency, and reliability across various data sources.
Establish a centralized data repository to serve as the single source of truth for carbone data within the organization.


2/ Provide Cross Functional Teams (Science Hub, Manufacturing And Supply, Procurement, Brands) With The Relevant Data Support To Help Them To Articulate Their Decarbonization Road Map


Develop and maintain data visualisation (dashboards, reports, and performance metrics) to track key Decarbonization indicators.
Conduct scenario analysis and predictive modeling to assess the potential decarbonation opportunities and identify opportunities for operational efficiencies, cost savings, and revenue generation through carbon-related initiatives.
Provide training and support to internal stakeholders on data access, data visualization tools, and best practices for utilizing the centralized data repository effectively.


3/ Develop our Net Zero Digital transformation roadmap

Qualifications


Master’s degree in Data science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
5-7 years of experience in similar data management role
Statistical modeling / data analysis experience in R, Python, SAS or similar tools
Strong SQL command and the ability to write complex queries on big data sets
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with machine learning and predictive analytics.
Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources including web APIs, databases and flat files.
Data Experience applied in a Scope 3 / Product Carbon foot-printing context is a strong plus.
Ability to convey complex data insights clearly
Analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Why us?

At Opella, you will enjoy doing challenging, purposeful work, empowered to develop consumer brands with passion and creativity. This is your chance to grow new skills and be part of a bold, collaborative, and inclusive culture where people can thrive and be at their best every day.

We Are Challengers.

We Are Dedicated To Making Self-care As Simple As It Should Be. That Starts With Our Culture. We Are Challengers By Nature, And This Is How We Do Things

All In Together: We keep each other honest and have each other's backs.

Courageous: We break boundaries and take thoughtful risks with creativity.

Outcome-Obsessed: We are personally accountable, driving sustainable impact and results with integrity.

Radically Simple: We strive to make things simple for us and simple for consumers, as it should be.

Join us on our mission. Health. In your hands.

www.opella.com/en/careers


Show more

Opella is the self-care challenger with the purest and third-largest portfolio in the Over-The-Counter (OTC) & Vitamins, Minerals & Supplements (VMS) market globally.  

Our mission is to bring health in people’s hands by making self-care as simple as it should be. For half a billion consumers worldwide – and counting.

At the core of this mission is our 100 loved brands, our 11,000-strong global team, our 13 best-in-class manufacturing sites and 4 specialized science and innovation development centers. Headquartered in France, Opella is the proud maker of many of the world’s most loved brands, including Allegra, Buscopan, Doliprane, Dulcolax, Enterogermina, Essentiale and Mucosolvan.

B Corp certified in multiple markets, we are active players in the journey towards healthier people and planet. Find out more about our mission at www.opella.com.

About The Job

Opella's promise is to challenge the conventions of care and define a whole new way to think about health – for our people, our communities, and our planet. And we mean our words: Opella is BCorp certified and our Net Zero Target has been submitted to the Science Base Target initiative for approval.

In that context of our net zero transformation, we are looking for a Climate Data Analyst who will play a pivotal role in developing new Data analytics and Data Science techniques to inform decision-making and fuel our Decarbonization roadmap.

In this position, you will report to our NetZero Transformation lead.

The position is based in Barcelona (Spain).

Key Responsibilities

1/ Ensure Carbon data are collected, actionable, governed, scalable and integrated throughout the organization:

  • Design pragmatic solutions to improve calculation methods from primary systems and develop automated data collection processes and pipelines to ensure timely and accurate acquisition of data, utilizing APIs and database connections.
  • Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to design and optimize data architectures, storage solutions, and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes for efficient data management and access.
  • Implement data stewardship and governance to maintain data integrity, consistency, and reliability across various data sources.
  • Establish a centralized data repository to serve as the single source of truth for carbone data within the organization.

2/ Provide Cross Functional Teams (Science Hub, Manufacturing And Supply, Procurement, Brands) With The Relevant Data Support To Help Them To Articulate Their Decarbonization Road Map

  • Develop and maintain data visualisation (dashboards, reports, and performance metrics) to track key Decarbonization indicators.
  • Conduct scenario analysis and predictive modeling to assess the potential decarbonation opportunities and identify opportunities for operational efficiencies, cost savings, and revenue generation through carbon-related initiatives.
  • Provide training and support to internal stakeholders on data access, data visualization tools, and best practices for utilizing the centralized data repository effectively.

3/ Develop our Net Zero Digital transformation roadmap

Qualifications

  • Master’s degree in Data science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
  • 5-7 years of experience in similar data management role
  • Statistical modeling / data analysis experience in R, Python, SAS or similar tools
  • Strong SQL command and the ability to write complex queries on big data sets
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
  • Familiarity with machine learning and predictive analytics.
  • Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources including web APIs, databases and flat files.
  • Data Experience applied in a Scope 3 / Product Carbon foot-printing context is a strong plus.
  • Ability to convey complex data insights clearly
  • Analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Why us?

At Opella, you will enjoy doing challenging, purposeful work, empowered to develop consumer brands with passion and creativity. This is your chance to grow new skills and be part of a bold, collaborative, and inclusive culture where people can thrive and be at their best every day.

We Are Challengers.

We Are Dedicated To Making Self-care As Simple As It Should Be. That Starts With Our Culture. We Are Challengers By Nature, And This Is How We Do Things

All In Together: We keep each other honest and have each other's backs.

Courageous: We break boundaries and take thoughtful risks with creativity.

Outcome-Obsessed: We are personally accountable, driving sustainable impact and results with integrity.

Radically Simple: We strive to make things simple for us and simple for consumers, as it should be.

Join us on our mission. Health. In your hands.

www.opella.com/en/careers

Title: Becario Data Analyst
Description:
Ubicación: Barcelona / Híbrido

Tipo de contrato: Jornada completa

Departamento: Estrategia Datos

En Solfy estamos revolucionando el sector de la energía en hogares con instalaciones de autoconsumo, aerotermia y cargadores de vehículo eléctrico. Para acompañar nuestro crecimiento, buscamos una persona clave: un/a Data Analyst que lidere la creación de cuadros de mando 360 que conecten todas las áreas del negocio y permitan crear herramientas de datos para la toma de decisiones

¿Qué harás en tu día a día?


Serás el nexo entre los datos y la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Diseñarás y mantendrás dashboards accionables y escalables en herramientas como Google Looker Studio, Power BI o similares.
Recogerás necesidades y KPIs de diferentes áreas: marketing, ventas, project management, tramitaciones, atención al cliente y financiero.
Crearás visualizaciones interactivas con filtros que permitan interaccionar con los datos de forma intuitiva por parte de los responsables.
Propondrás mejoras de negocio a partir del análisis de los datos.
Asegurarás la calidad y trazabilidad de los datos, colaborando con los equipos técnicos si es necesario.


Requisitos


Perfil analítico, autónomo, proactivo y con mentalidad de producto.
Capacidad para hablar con equipos diversos y entender sus necesidades sin tecnicismos innecesarios.
Experiencia previa creando dashboard
s en entornos cloud (Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Buen dominio de Excel, SQL y herramientas de tratamiento de datos.
Capacidad de trabajar en entornos ágiles y en evolución constante.


Beneficios


Formar parte de una empresa con propósito: acelerar la transición energética en España.
Autonomía real para construir desde cero los sistemas de reporting que impactan en toda la compañía.
Entorno dinámico, joven y colaborativo, sin burocracias.
Oficinas en el centro de Barcelona y posibilidad de trabajo híbrido.
Posibilidades de crecimiento profesional en una empresa en expansión.


Looker, Power BI, Tableau, SQL, Excel

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
As a Data Analyst Senior, you are in charge of building SQL, Qlik and PowerBI data models to support key business decisions. You will collaborate with our product owners, guide your team members and work closely with our clients on their challenges requiring Data Foundations, Data Analytics, and Data Science.

As a Data Analyst Senior, you work closely with data engineers, bi analysts and product owners to create fast, efficient, and scalable data intelligence solutions for Werfen employees.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

• Between 2 to 3 years of experience in a similar role, managing a team or multiple projects. Preferably in the digital/tech and health/diagnostics/life science space.

•Work with the team and business stakeholders to identify requirements, define models, and kickstart new analytics initiatives.

•Build data models with SQL and automate them with Python. Have deep knowledge of all the datasets inside the data lake to be able to provide guidance to stakeholders.

•Apply the correct data models to the business problem at hand.

•Leverage creative solutions, analytics, and visualization/ reporting techniques to enhance knowledge and drive actionable insights that deliver ROI.







Networking/Key relationships

Critical to be able to build relationships based in trust within the organization as the function is to respond to the internal customer needs while taking into consideration the overall corporate strategy.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

• SQL advanced

• Good knowledge of any programming language like Python

• Power BI, Qlik or other dashboarding software

• Statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular libraries and tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.




We will consider it an advantage if you also have familiarity with any of the following:

• AWS

• Microsoft Azure cloud computing

• Familiarity with DataOps principles

• Familiar with Agile methodologies

• Git software versioning




Skills & Capabilities: We expect you to demonstrate proficiency in data analysis and have a keen interest in understanding various business domains. We will also need you to be able to communicate data concepts to non-technical colleagues.

• You are fluent in English both orally and in writing.

• You have good presentation skills.

• You can communicate well within the team and with stakeholders.

• You can analyze business requirements in dialogue with internal stakeholders.

• You can collaborate directly with external consultants and vendors.

• You are a team player willing to share knowledge, ideas, and banter.




Travel requirements: 5% of time

Show more

Title: Logistics Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo’s logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

Title: Junior Data (Power BI)
Description:
We’re looking for a junior data talent with an eye for detail, a structured mindset, and a solid grasp of Power BI to help us turn raw data into clear, actionable insights.




This is a hands-on role, ideal for someone early in their career who wants to grow in a supportive environment without needing to own the whole data architecture from day one. You’ll be part of our Customer Operations team, helping stakeholders (internal and external) make smart decisions with reliable dashboards and visual reports.




If you love making data look good, enjoy solving real business problems, and want to keep learning, we’d love to meet you.




🔧 What you’ll do

Build and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI to support Product, Finance, Customer Success, and more stakeholders.
Help ensure data consistency and clarity across teams and tools.
Work closely with internal teams to understand what they need and translate that into effective, clean reporting.
Maintain and improve our reporting documentation for easier reusability and team collaboration.
Spot data inconsistencies or blockers and suggest simple, scalable improvements.
Learn from our more experienced teammates (and from real projects!) every week.




🧰 What we’re looking for

Experience working with Power BI or other data visualization tools
Solid knowledge of SQL to extract and explore data.
A love for visual storytelling through data.
Organized, curious, and comfortable asking questions when things aren’t clear.
Familiarity with Excel, Google Sheets or other BI/reporting tools.




💡 Bonus points for…

Basic understanding of Python, DAX or Power Query.
Exposure to SaaS or travel-related environments.
Experience working in cross-functional teams
A mindset of learning by doing.




🤝 Why join Caravelo

You’ll learn and grow by working closely with senior colleagues, real data, and global clients.
With a culture of openness, autonomy, and collaboration, we trust you to do your best work.
A flexible, hybrid setup with a team that’s kind, fun, and gets things done.
You’ll have a real impact — the dashboards and reports you build will directly inform company decisions.




🛫 At Caravelo, data is not just reporting. It’s how we improve, evolve, and scale.




If you're looking for a role where you’ll grow fast, be trusted, and build real things from day one, we’d love to hear from you.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst PowerBI (Sector Público)
Description:
#SomosAltia

Llevamos más de 30 años creando soluciones digitales preparadas para el futuro, capaces de generar valor real y provocar cambios significativos.

Somos un equipo de más de 4.000 grandes profesionales repartidos en más de 30 localizaciones de 10 países que, desde 1994, suman su energía y aplican su visión innovadora de la tecnología a proyectos realmente relevantes, para más de 1.000 organizaciones que son motores del cambio.

Nos mueve un claro propósito: crecer haciendo crecer, y hacerlo, además, de forma sostenible y duradera. Tenemos claro que solo seremos importantes si juntos aportamos un impacto positivo y todos evolucionamos en el proceso.

Con unos valores intactos, somos una de las primeras compañías independientes del sector. Altia cotiza, desde 2010, en el BME Growth, el mercado de las empresas en expansión.

#SeekingYou

En Altia seguimos creciendo y buscamos un/a Data Analyst PowerBI para unirse a nuestro equipo.

En concreto, buscamos a alguien con al menos 4-5 años de experiencia y con conocimiento profundo de la herramienta PowerBI.

Algunas de las tareas del puesto son:


Comprender las necesidades de negocio.
Modelar las soluciones.
Elegir las mejores visualizaciones de datos para caso.
Construir los dashboards aplicando las mejores prácticas.
Definir y aplicar las normas de calidad de datos dentro de Power BI para asegurar que los datos utilizados en los informes y visualizaciones sean precisos, consistentes y fiables.
Migraciones.


Se trata de un proyecto ambicioso para una importante Administración Pública.

¿Qué tenemos para ti?

🌎 Posibilidad de trabajar desde cualquier ciudad de España (preferiblemente Cataluña)

⏳Horario flexible y jornada de verano🔆

📈Puesto estable con perspectivas de crecimiento según tus intereses profesionales

💼 Plan de formación continua que te permitirá evolucionar en tu carrera profesional

💙Formarás parte de un equipo consolidado y con experiencia 💪

✨Trabajarás en proyectos con grandes clientes

🎯 Retribución flexible y competitiva
Show more

⏳Horario flexible y jornada de verano🔆

📈Puesto estable con perspectivas de crecimiento según tus intereses profesionales

💼 Plan de formación continua que te permitirá evolucionar en tu carrera profesional

💙Formarás parte de un equipo consolidado y con experiencia 💪

✨Trabajarás en proyectos con grandes clientes

🎯 Retribución flexible y competitiva

Title: Analytics Consultant - Customer & Marketing
Description:
¿Te imaginas participando en la transformación de las principales organizaciones nacionales e internacionales?

En Deloitte estamos comprometidos con generar un impacto en la sociedad, en nuestros clientes y en ti.

Perfil analytics responsable de recopilar, analizar e interpretar datos a través de la aplicación de analítica avanzada para proporcionar insights de alto valor y recomendaciones estratégicas a nuestros clientes con el objetivo de mejorar la toma de decisiones.

Principales funciones que deberá cumplir el aspirante:


Extracción de datos de las diferentes fuentes y BBDD para su análisis, asegurando su integridad y calidad
Realizar análisis avanzados con un alto volumen de datos y aplicar técnicas de transformación para la obtención de insights de alto valor
Crear reportes automatizados y Dashboards con el objetivo de mostrar resultados de manera clara e intuitiva
Entender los requerimientos y necesidades de las partes involucradas proporcionando soluciones técnicas de valor. Al mismo tiempo, deberá reconocer omisiones o ambigüedades de los requisitos proporcionados por los usuarios.
Identificar oportunidades de mejora y optimización en base a los análisis realizados
Participar en la implementación y seguimiento de estrategias basadas en el dato
Presentar los resultados y las estrategias definidas al equipo directivo
Capacidad de detectar necesidades de clientes en referencia a la Inteligencia Artificial y entender las posibles soluciones técnicas (valorable)
Entender el entorno tecnológico de los clientes y mantenerse al día sobre las últimas tendencias y herramientas de análisis de datos
OFICINA:
Deloitte Digital - Barcelona
REQUISITOS SOLICITADOS PARA EL PUESTO
Alto conocimiento técnico: Conocimientos sólidos en herramientas y técnicas de análisis de datos. Esto incluye experiencia avanzada en el uso de herramientas de SQL, Python o R. Conocimientos de herramientas de Business Intelligence como Power BI, Tableau o Qlik. Se valorará tener nociones de Adobe Analytics o Google Analytics.
Interpretación y presentación de datos: Capacidad de interpretar los resultados del análisis de datos y traducirlos en información accionable para los diferentes equipos y partes interesadas
Conocimiento de negocio: Capacidad de traducir los objetivos empresariales en cuestiones analíticas, identificar las métricas clave de rendimiento (KPI) relevantes y realizar análisis avanzados orientados a resultados
Capacidad resolutiva: Abordar desafíos complejos relacionados con la analítica. Capacidad de identificar y resolver problemas técnicos, detectar anomalías o errores en los datos y proponer mejoras en los procesos analíticos existentes
Comunicación : Deberá demostrar altas habilidades de comunicación para interactuar stakehoders de todos los niveles, defender conclusiones y propuestas tecnológicas y trabajar en equipo con perfiles de diferentes áreas

¿Cómo es trabajar en Deloitte?

🤩 Proyectos de alto impacto donde tendrás un largo recorrido y aprendizaje

☯️ Un día a día híbrido-flexible: tendrás horario flexible y un buen equilibrio entre el teletrabajo y el trabajo en equipo en nuestras oficinas o las de nuestros clientes

⚽ Buen ambiente dentro y fuera de la oficina: disfrutarás de varios teambuildings al año, actividades culturales y deportivas… ¡y mucho más!

🧘‍♀️ Bienestar integral: cuídate con nuestro programa de salud física, mental y financiera… ¡y con equipo médico en las oficinas!

🤲 Impacto social: Podrás apuntarte a una gran cantidad de voluntariados de alcance nacional e internacional y a proyectos pro-bono con los que poner tu tiempo y talento al servicio de quienes más lo necesitan

🗣️ Cultura del feedback y aprendizaje continuo: crecerás en un entorno inclusivo donde la igualdad de oportunidades y tu plan personalizado de formación impulsarán tu desarrollo. ¿Ya te visualizas en la Deloitte University de París?

🤝 Beneficios exclusivos por ser parte de Deloitte: podrás disfrutar de un gran catálogo de beneficios y de un completo plan de retribución flexible

Si te gusta lo que lees, estos son tus próximos pasos:


Aplica a la oferta haciendo clic en ‘Enviar candidatura ahora’ y completa tu perfil
Si encajas en el puesto, nuestro equipo de talento te contactará para conocerte mejor


¡Comienza el proceso! Te iremos guiando por las diferentes fases hasta tu incorporación.

Title: Analista de Datos (Estadística)
Description:
Buscamos incorporar un Data Analyst o Analista de Datos (Estadística) para una agencia de marketing relacional, especializada en acciones de captación y fidelización de clientes, en Barcelona.

Sobre el puesto:

Necesitamos una persona con altas capacidad de análisis de ventas y gestión de bases de datos, para incorporarse al equipo especializado en acciones para la red comercial del sector automoción. La persona deberá gestionar los incentivos online que requieren tener capacidad para desarrollar las siguientes funciones:

Funciones:

Validación de datos a través de Excel.
Análisis de necesidades funcionales (requisitos y modelos de ficheros base) para poder desarrollar un briefing de programación para back y un briefing creativo para front.
Contacto con equipo de programadores y equipo creativo para puesta en marcha y cumplimiento de timings.
Seguimiento de los proyectos (anuales) con carga mensual de datos y validación de resultados.
Gestionar plan contactos mediante email marketing.
Gestión del día a día con el cliente.

Requisitos:

Licenciatura en Ciencias de la Información, Ciencias Empresariales, Estadística, ADE o similares.
3 / 5 años de experiencia en posición similar como Analista de Datos o Trade Marketing.
Dominio nivel experto de Excel.
Otras herramientas de análisis de datos serán valoradas, pero no imprescindibles (PowerBI)
Alta capacidad de analizar y gestionar datos.
Analista de ventas con experiencia en gestión de bases de datos.
Inglés valorable, pero no imprescindible.
2 días/semana trabajo en remoto.

Hard skills:

Sentido común y capacidad para aprender.
Persona proactiva, curiosa, orientada a hacer su trabajo y también a mejorarlo. Buscamos una persona que ejecute unas funciones, pero que tenga capacidad de análisis y que interprete los resultados de su trabajo en búsqueda de mejoras.
Trabajo en equipo: que sepa trabajar de forma autónoma e integrada al mismo tiempo dentro de un equipo.
Persona activa y con iniciativa.

Si eres un profesional con experiencia directamente relacionada con la posición, el empleo de Data Analyst o Analista de Datos es para ti.

¡Inscríbete hoy mismo a este apasionante puesto y comienza ya un nuevo reto profesional!

Title: Data Analyst | Reviewpro Reputation
Description:
Shiji is a global technology company dedicated to providing innovative solutions for the hospitality industry, ensuring seamless operations for hoteliers day and night.



Built on the Shiji Platform—the only truly global hotel technology platform—Shiji’s cloud-based portfolio includes Property Management System, Point-of-Sale, guest engagement, distribution, payments, and data intelligence solutions for over 91,000 hotels worldwide, including the largest chains.



The best hotels run on Shiji—day and night.



Shiji Reviewpro Reputation is at the forefront of the hospitality technology landscape, offering intuitive software solutions that empower hoteliers to provide outstanding guest experiences while optimizing operational efficiency. Our suite of products includes robust workflow automation and guest messaging tools designed to fit the fast-paced nature of the hospitality industry.



We are expanding our team, and are currently looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Data Analyst, to contribute to our international growth. The ideal candidate will have experience with data analysis and, be comfortable with technology / SaaS Business Intelligence Tools, and is motivated by the opportunity to develop new ways to ensure a 100% data delivery & quality with the least effort possible.





Job Description



Reporting to the Senior Data Analyst within the Product team, the responsibilities include:



Perform data analysis and special reports for key clients, marketing and sales to identify data-driven trends and understand what matters and why.
Prepare excellent presentations, and consultancy documents to be delivered to clients.
Prioritize projects and the special data reporting pipeline and delivery times.
Execute, build and maintain data projects using Python, Excel, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio and some other data analysis tools like SPSS.
Structure, organize and maintain masses of information from different DBs to efficiently deliver on time the projects in pipeline.
Collaborate with the product managers to develop new visualizations, CRM data analysis and special data projects.


Qualifications



Candidates must be motivated, proactive and responsible individuals with:



Highly analytical mind.
Advanced Excel user.
Advanced Python user.
Experience managing the main Business Intelligence tool (Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Experience with advanced statistical methodology with knowledge in Python.
Desirable knowledge in managing data through MySQL and API connections.
Results oriented.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work well under pressure and manage their own time to deliver the task / projects.
Desirable knowledge in the Hotels sector and online reputation.
Excellent level of English, Spanish is a plus.
Degree or being studying information technology, business administration, engineering or mathematical sciences.


Additional Information


Exciting job within a creative environment and the opportunity to make a real impact on the business.
Grow your experience with web and cloud technologies in a very innovative technology environment.
Friendly, motivated and talented multicultural team.
Opportunities to grow and develop with Shiji.
Team building activities and charity donation programs
Discounts on a private health insurance, ticket, restaurant, transport, kindergarten.
