Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are

At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we’ve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising €250M to revolutionise digital advertising.




Your Challenge




You will get full ownership of our business data and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag’s data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyse the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag’s commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing the efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratisation of data inside the company and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




What You’ll Need to Succeed




You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications/education in Data/ Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar, and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modelling.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.
Have experience working with Tableau.




Why Join Seedtag?




Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks




Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure?




Send us your CV and let’s grow together!

At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🔵 En CAPITOLE, ¡seguimos creciendo y queremos hacerlo contigo!




Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con al menos 3 años de experiencia para unirse a un proyecto internacional de gran impacto. La posición es híbrida, 1 vez por semana a oficina en los alrededores de Barcelona.




💻 ¿Qué perfil estamos buscando?

3+ años de experiencia en análisis de datos o roles similares.
Dominio avanzado de Tableau y de SQL para consultas complejas y manipulación de grandes conjuntos de datos.
Conocimientos sólidos sobre estructuras de datos, bases de datos relacionales y procesos ETL.
Se valora experiencia con Python o R.
Disponibilidad para ir 1 día a la semana a oficinas por la zona de Barcelona.
Inglés alto.




🥳 ¿Por qué CAPITOLE?

Presupuesto de formación de €1,200 para que lo gastes en lo que desees (eventos de tecnología, libros, cursos, certificaciones, ¡lo que quieras!). 📚
Reuniones mensuales con tu equipo para asegurar una retroalimentación continua. 🔄
Seguro médico privado cubierto en su totalidad por Capitole. 🏥
Compensación flexible (vales de restaurante, transporte y/o guardería). 🍽️🚇
Acceso a Wellhub (Gympass). 🏋️‍♀️
Descuentos exclusivos en marcas top (Club Capitole). 🛍️




¿Aún no nos conoces? ¡Descúbrenos! 👀




¡No dudes en enviarnos tu perfil; estamos ansiosos por conocerte!




#CAPITOLECONSULTING




El empleado/a se adherirá a las políticas de seguridad de la información:

- Tendrá acceso a la información confidencial relativa a Capitole y al proyecto en el que trabaja.

- Tendrá que cumplir las políticas de seguridad y las políticas internas de la empresa y cliente.

- Tendrá que firmar un NDA.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Sobre nosotros:




En ORBIDI, somos pioneros en el uso de tecnología avanzada, inteligencia artificial y modelos predictivos para propulsar el crecimiento de las pequeñas y medianas empresas (PYMEs). Nuestra pasión por la innovación y el marketing nos motiva a buscar soluciones creativas que permitan a las empresas no solo competir, sino destacar en el mercado actual. Creemos firmemente en el poder de la digitalización y cómo esta puede transformar los negocios para mejor. Buscamos talentos creativos y estratégicos que compartan nuestra visión y deseo de hacer una diferencia tangible en el mundo empresarial.




El rol:




Estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst (con enfoque en Operaciones y Ventas) para unirse a nuestro equipo y liderar iniciativas clave en análisis avanzado, forecasting y visualización de datos.

Tu trabajo será fundamental para guiar decisiones estratégicas en operaciones y ventas, mediante el diseño de modelos predictivos, reporting inteligente y análisis profundo de datos.




¿Cuál será tu misión?




Diseñar, implementar y optimizar modelos de aprendizaje automático enfocados en eficiencia operativa y predicción de ventas.
Explorar y procesar grandes volúmenes de datos, garantizando su calidad e integridad.
Crear dashboards interactivos y visualizaciones impactantes que ayuden a los equipos de operaciones y ventas a entender los datos y tomar mejores decisiones.
Colaborar de forma transversal con equipos de producto, ingeniería, operaciones y ventas para entender sus retos y proponer soluciones basadas en datos.
Aplicar técnicas estadísticas avanzadas como regresión, pruebas de hipótesis o análisis de series temporales para prever tendencias y mejorar procesos.
Diseñar y analizar experimentos A/B para validar hipótesis y optimizar resultados.
Trabajar con herramientas cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure) y tecnologías de Big Data para desarrollar soluciones escalables y eficientes.
Contribuir al desarrollo de una cultura de datos sólida, participando en la definición de políticas de gobernanza y buenas prácticas.




Lo que te hará triunfar:




+2 años de experiencia en ciencia de datos, análisis o machine learning, preferiblemente aplicados a operaciones y ventas.
Dominio de Python o R, junto con bibliotecas como Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn.
Conocimiento sólido en SQL y experiencia consultando bases de datos complejas.
Experiencia utilizando herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o matplotlib.
Familiaridad con plataformas cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Habilidad para traducir resultados técnicos en mensajes claros y accionables para stakeholders no técnicos.
Mentalidad proactiva, enfoque en la colaboración y pasión por resolver problemas complejos.




Beneficios:

🕑Flexibilidad horaria
💎Oficinas modernas en Sant Cugat, frente a la estación de FGC de Mirasol.
💰Salario competitivo y contrato indefinido
🤑Bonus basado en el cumplimiento de objetivos de tu equipo
🌴23 días laborales de vacaciones + 🎂día de cumpleaños
🏠Formato Híbrido/ Remoto
😍Jornada intensiva todos los viernes del año.
📅Agosto flexible
🥳Actividades de teambuilding y celebraciones y off-sites
🤩Referral Program
🤸🏻‍♀️Descuento en gimnasio
🍎Fruta en oficina

Si tienes una pasión por el marketing digital, la creación de contenido y el diseño, y buscas un rol donde puedas dejar tu huella y contribuir al éxito de las PYMEs, ¡ORBIDI es el lugar para ti!

Show more
HTML:
Sobre nosotros:


En ORBIDI, somos pioneros en el uso de tecnología avanzada, inteligencia artificial y modelos predictivos para propulsar el crecimiento de las pequeñas y medianas empresas (PYMEs). Nuestra pasión por la innovación y el marketing nos motiva a buscar soluciones creativas que permitan a las empresas no solo competir, sino destacar en el mercado actual. Creemos firmemente en el poder de la digitalización y cómo esta puede transformar los negocios para mejor. Buscamos talentos creativos y estratégicos que compartan nuestra visión y deseo de hacer una diferencia tangible en el mundo empresarial.


El rol:


Estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst (con enfoque en Operaciones y Ventas) para unirse a nuestro equipo y liderar iniciativas clave en análisis avanzado, forecasting y visualización de datos.

Tu trabajo será fundamental para guiar decisiones estratégicas en operaciones y ventas, mediante el diseño de modelos predictivos, reporting inteligente y análisis profundo de datos.


¿Cuál será tu misión?


  • Diseñar, implementar y optimizar modelos de aprendizaje automático enfocados en eficiencia operativa y predicción de ventas.
  • Explorar y procesar grandes volúmenes de datos, garantizando su calidad e integridad.
  • Crear dashboards interactivos y visualizaciones impactantes que ayuden a los equipos de operaciones y ventas a entender los datos y tomar mejores decisiones.
  • Colaborar de forma transversal con equipos de producto, ingeniería, operaciones y ventas para entender sus retos y proponer soluciones basadas en datos.
  • Aplicar técnicas estadísticas avanzadas como regresión, pruebas de hipótesis o análisis de series temporales para prever tendencias y mejorar procesos.
  • Diseñar y analizar experimentos A/B para validar hipótesis y optimizar resultados.
  • Trabajar con herramientas cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure) y tecnologías de Big Data para desarrollar soluciones escalables y eficientes.
  • Contribuir al desarrollo de una cultura de datos sólida, participando en la definición de políticas de gobernanza y buenas prácticas.


Lo que te hará triunfar:


  • +2 años de experiencia en ciencia de datos, análisis o machine learning, preferiblemente aplicados a operaciones y ventas.
  • Dominio de Python o R, junto con bibliotecas como Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn.
  • Conocimiento sólido en SQL y experiencia consultando bases de datos complejas.
  • Experiencia utilizando herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o matplotlib.
  • Familiaridad con plataformas cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure).
  • Habilidad para traducir resultados técnicos en mensajes claros y accionables para stakeholders no técnicos.
  • Mentalidad proactiva, enfoque en la colaboración y pasión por resolver problemas complejos.


Beneficios:

  • 🕑Flexibilidad horaria
  • 💎Oficinas modernas en Sant Cugat, frente a la estación de FGC de Mirasol.
  • 💰Salario competitivo y contrato indefinido
  • 🤑Bonus basado en el cumplimiento de objetivos de tu equipo
  • 🌴23 días laborales de vacaciones + 🎂día de cumpleaños
  • 🏠Formato Híbrido/ Remoto
  • 😍Jornada intensiva todos los viernes del año.
  • 📅Agosto flexible
  • 🥳Actividades de teambuilding y celebraciones y off-sites
  • 🤩Referral Program
  • 🤸🏻‍♀️Descuento en gimnasio
  • 🍎Fruta en oficina

Si tienes una pasión por el marketing digital, la creación de contenido y el diseño, y buscas un rol donde puedas dejar tu huella y contribuir al éxito de las PYMEs, ¡ORBIDI es el lugar para ti!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¡En K-LAGAN te estamos esperando para continuar creciendo juntos!




Somos una empresa estratégica internacional de servicios tecnológicos, comprometida esencialmente con su equipo y con la sociedad. Ofrecemos soluciones en servicios IT, desarrollos de ingeniería, de electrónica, y proyectos de I+D. Nuestro compromiso es contratar a los mejores talentos independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades, promoviendo su desarrollo profesional y personal.




Misión: Como Data Analyst, tendrás responsabilidad por todos los temas relacionados con el análisis web, por el desarrollo de estándares de seguimiento y análisis en todo el grupo, así como por la armonización de nuestra configuración.




Nuestro perfil ideal cuenta con:

Experiencia en Cloud Azure (PowerBI Premium / Visual studio / Azure analytics services)
Experiencia en SQL
Dominio de Business intelligence
Inglés Alto




Nuestro proceso de selección incluye:

Primera entrevista
Entrevista técnica
Entrevista Final




Además, en K-LAGAN, queremos que disfrutes de toda la experiencia completa de ser parte de nuestro equipo, por ello ofrecemos:




¡Imprescindible! Contrato indefinido y proyecto estable.
Modalidad: Proyecto Hibrido
Team Building: Barbacoas, cafés tecnológicos e igual este año se nos ocurren más cosas para estar más cerca de vosotros.
Seguimiento continuo: contarás con nuestros fantásticos TBM para seguir creciendo y tener feedback sobre tu desempeño y día a día.
Departamento y formación de carreras ¿Quieres dar el siguiente paso? ¡Te ayudamos!
Eventos: Cena de verano, Cena de Navidad y Día Solidario.
Dia de cumpleaños libre: ¡disfrútalo cómo, dónde y con quién quieras!
Ayuda en guarderías, KM e idiomas.




¿Crees que podría ser interesante para ti?




¡Escríbeme y lo comentamos!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Inetum es líder europeo en servicios digitales. El equipo de 28.000 consultores y expertos de Inetum se esfuerza cada día por lograr un impacto digital en las empresas, en las entidades del sector público y en la sociedad. Las soluciones de Inetum quieren contribuir al rendimiento y la innovación de sus clientes, así como al interés general. Presente en 19 países con una red de centros densa, Inetum colabora con los principales fabricantes de software para afrontar los retos de la transformación digital con proximidad y flexibilidad. Impulsada por su ambición de crecimiento y expansión, Inetum generó una cifra de negocio de 2.500 millones de euros en 2023.







🎯 ¡Únete a INETUM como Data Analyst! 🎯

🔹 Responsabilidades:

Diseñar e implementar controles de datos.
Apoyar las pruebas UAT de controles implementados.
Garantizar que los controles cumplan con los estándares exigidos.
Mantener actualizada la documentación de controles.




🔹 Requisitos obligatorios:

Conocimientos en datos estructurados, bases de datos relacionales, herramientas de repositorio y metadatos.
Habilidades básicas en SQL.
Capacidad para documentar procesos cumpliendo requisitos como SoX.
Experiencia en identificación de problemas de calidad de datos, análisis de causa raíz y evaluación del impacto en negocio.
Manejo de herramientas de reporting ejecutivo sobre controles y sus resultados.
Habilidad para interpretar información técnica compleja y comunicarla a stakeholders no técnicos.




🚨 Nivel de inglés avanzado (C1 o superior) obligatorio. Candidaturas sin este nivel no serán consideradas.




🔹 Valorable:

Experiencia en selección de herramientas y técnicas para asegurar calidad de datos en procesos y flujos.
Conocimientos de políticas internas aplicables a gestión y gobernanza de datos.




🔹 Perfil:

Más de 2 años de experiencia.
Título universitario en disciplinas STEM.







NOTA: Posibilidad de trabajo en remoto SOLO candidaturas ubicadas en España.




💡¿QUÉ PODEMOS OFRECERTE?:

Retribución salarial acorde con la experiencia aportada
Plan de carrera: ofrecemos una atractiva carrera profesional en función de la experiencia y potencial personal dentro de una compañía en continua evolución y con un sólido crecimiento
Plan de formación en competencias tecnológicas de acuerdo con las exigencias de los proyectos y clientes.
Retribución flexible: te ofrecemos una retribución a la carta pudiendo elegir diferentes productos y modelar tú mismo cómo distribuirlos: seguro de salud, tickets de comida, guardería, tarjeta transporte, etc.
Flexibilidad horaria




Si cumples con los requisitos y quieres formar parte de un equipo dinámico, envíanos tu candidatura. CV en Inglés, necesario. ¡Te esperamos!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Savills España

Savills es una consultora inmobiliaria con 30 años de existencia en el mercado español y más de 150 años en el internacional, especializada en la creación de soluciones a medida para cualquier necesidad inmobiliaria.

Descripción de la oferta

En Savills España, consultora inmobiliaria internacional, queremos incorporar un/a Junior Data Analyst para formar parte del equipo de Valoraciones y Tasaciones de la Compañía basado/a en nuestras oficinas de Madrid.

Funciones


Automatizar y optimizar procesos de datos, especialmente los relacionados con reporting regulatorio.
Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards interactivos en Power BI para distintos equipos del negocio.
Integrar y gestionar APIs para el intercambio de datos.
Crear y adaptar queries SQL bajo demanda en SQL Server y PostgreSQL (PgAdmin).
Mantener procesos automatizados en entornos de oficina mediante VBA.
Participar activamente en el desarrollo y adopción de soluciones basadas en IA generativa.
Colaborar con equipos técnicos del área de Valoraciones y Tasaciones en el diseño y mejora de procesos de datos.
Documentar procesos técnicos y coordinar con áreas funcionales y tecnológicas.


Tecnologías y Herramientas Utilizadas


Bases de datos: SQL Server, PostgreSQL (PgAdmin)
Visualización: Power BI
Automatización: VBA para aplicaciones
Otras herramientas: APIs, soluciones de IA generativa
Se valorará: Conocimientos en Python y R


Requisitos


Formación en Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística, Informática, Economía o campos afines y master en Big Data, Análisis de datos, Data Mining y/o similares.
Valorable al menos 1 año de experiencia en las funciones descritas.
Interés por el análisis de datos, la automatización y las tecnologías emergentes.
Capacidad de aprendizaje continuo, pensamiento crítico y atención al detalle.
Habilidades de comunicación y trabajo en equipo en entornos multidisciplinarios

Title: Junior Data (Power BI)
Description:
We’re looking for a junior data talent with an eye for detail, a structured mindset, and a solid grasp of Power BI to help us turn raw data into clear, actionable insights.




This is a hands-on role, ideal for someone early in their career who wants to grow in a supportive environment without needing to own the whole data architecture from day one. You’ll be part of our Customer Operations team, helping stakeholders (internal and external) make smart decisions with reliable dashboards and visual reports.




If you love making data look good, enjoy solving real business problems, and want to keep learning, we’d love to meet you.




🔧 What you’ll do

Build and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI to support Product, Finance, Customer Success, and more stakeholders.
Help ensure data consistency and clarity across teams and tools.
Work closely with internal teams to understand what they need and translate that into effective, clean reporting.
Maintain and improve our reporting documentation for easier reusability and team collaboration.
Spot data inconsistencies or blockers and suggest simple, scalable improvements.
Learn from our more experienced teammates (and from real projects!) every week.




🧰 What we’re looking for

Experience working with Power BI or other data visualization tools
Solid knowledge of SQL to extract and explore data.
A love for visual storytelling through data.
Organized, curious, and comfortable asking questions when things aren’t clear.
Familiarity with Excel, Google Sheets or other BI/reporting tools.




💡 Bonus points for…

Basic understanding of Python, DAX or Power Query.
Exposure to SaaS or travel-related environments.
Experience working in cross-functional teams
A mindset of learning by doing.




🤝 Why join Caravelo

You’ll learn and grow by working closely with senior colleagues, real data, and global clients.
With a culture of openness, autonomy, and collaboration, we trust you to do your best work.
A flexible, hybrid setup with a team that’s kind, fun, and gets things done.
You’ll have a real impact — the dashboards and reports you build will directly inform company decisions.




🛫 At Caravelo, data is not just reporting. It’s how we improve, evolve, and scale.




If you're looking for a role where you’ll grow fast, be trusted, and build real things from day one, we’d love to hear from you.

Show more

🤝 Why join Caravelo

  • You’ll learn and grow by working closely with senior colleagues, real data, and global clients.
  • With a culture of openness, autonomy, and collaboration, we trust you to do your best work.
  • A flexible, hybrid setup with a team that’s kind, fun, and gets things done.
  • You’ll have a real impact — the dashboards and reports you build will directly inform company decisions.


🛫 At Caravelo, data is not just reporting. It’s how we improve, evolve, and scale.


If you're looking for a role where you’ll grow fast, be trusted, and build real things from day one, we’d love to hear from you.

Title: Prácticas tecnológicas en Protección de Datos
Description:
¡No te pierdas esta oportunidad en Mutua Madrileña! ¿Buscas una oportunidad para poner en práctica tus conocimientos?

Comienza tu carrera profesional en Mutua Madrileña y encontrarás:

Experiencia real: participa en proyectos innovadores y desafiantes que te permitirán desarrollar tus habilidades.
Mentores cualificados que te acompañarán en tu desarrollo.
Formación técnica.
Ambiente dinámico, ¡serás uno más del equipo!
Atractiva ayuda al estudio.

Contenido de las practicas:

Colaborar en el análisis de jurisprudencia y doctrina de la AEPD

Apoyo en la revisión y actualización de procedimientos y metodología del área.

Apoyo en las tareas relativas a la seguridad de los datos de carácter personal, como:

Análisis de riesgos de seguridad de los tratamientos de datos personales nuevos y actualización de los existentes

Seguimiento de la implantación de medidas de seguridad que mitiguen los riesgos identificados en los tratamientos

Análisis de seguridad de nuevas plataformas, iniciativas y proveedores según la metodología desarrollada internamente

Registro y seguimiento de las incidencias y/o brechas de seguridad con impacto en los datos de carácter personal

Análisis de contratos con elementos tecnológicos, con objeto de asesorar acerca de los medios del tratamiento y sus riesgos técnicos, así como revisar las cláusulas sobre medidas de seguridad que aseguren el tratamiento a llevar a cabo

Contribución en la elaboración de informes, reporting y entregables del área sobre consultas jurídicas, análisis de riesgos, PIAs, etc.

Title: Data & Strategy Analyst
Description:
Desde Morgan Philips Specialist Recruitment estamos buscando un Data & Strategy Analyst para una importante compañía del sector finance:







Requisitos:

Grado en Estadística, Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Economía, ADE o similar.
Mínimo 2-3 años de experiencia en análisis de datos y reporting estratégico.
Experiencia analizando información relacionada con herramientas de marketing automation (valorable Salesforce Marketing Cloud).

Conocimientos técnicos:

Dominio avanzado de SQL.
Conocimiento sólido en la explotación de información del ecosistema de Google (GA4, valorable BigQuery). Capacidad para:
Configurar, interpretar y extraer insights sobre el comportamiento de usuarios en sitios web y apps con Google Analytics 4 (GA4).
Consultar grandes volúmenes de datos usando SQL para análisis avanzados con Google BigQuery.
Construir dashboards visuales que muestren indicadores clave de forma clara y útil con Google Data Studio (Looker Studio).
Dominio avanzado de herramientas de visualización como Power BI, Tableau, Looker o similar.
Conocimientos básicos de Python o R

Title: 28802 / Administrativo/a - Citación y Admisión - Madrid (Fuenlabrada)
Description:
En Quirónprevención, buscamos contar con el mejor talento, el tuyo. Somos la compañía líder en el sector y queremos que formes parte de un gran proyecto en expansión y que tiene siempre presente que las personas son lo primero.

¡Ayúdanos a marcar la diferencia!

En el departamento de Recursos Humanos estamos al servicio de los profesionales internos y de aquellos que están por venir, por eso tenemos unos criterios sólidos:


Las personas, el activo más importante de nuestra empresa.
Compartimos y transmitimos el valor de nuestra vocación.
La curiosidad y la creatividad nuestro ADN.
El compromiso de promover la igualdad de oportunidades, basándonos en un sistema de mérito profesional, garantizando asimismo la igualdad efectiva de mujeres y hombres.



¿Quieres formar parte del equipo? ¡Queremos conocerte!

Seleccionamos perfil de Auxiliar Administrativo o Administrativa para dar soporte en una de nuestras delegaciones. Como parte del equipo en nuestro centro en Madrid (Fuenlabrada), te encargarás principalmente de llevar a cabo las siguientes funciones:


Atención telefónica.
Recibimiento de los pacientes.
Otras tareas administrativas y de soporte necesarias para el buen funcionamiento de la oficina.



Se ofrece:


Contrato indefinido.
Horario distribuido de lunes a viernes de 7:15 a 15:00 con flexibilidad horaria que nos permite la conciliación personal y familiar.
Salario de mercado.
Convenio propio y beneficios sociales con importantes mejoras respecto al sector:
30 días laborales de vacaciones y 24 y 31 de diciembre no laborables. Mejoras en permisos retribuidos.
Fondo de ayudas a la persona trabajadora para gastos de enfermedad grave, situaciones de especial necesidad, gastos oftalmológicos, dentales y ortopedia entre otros.
Plan de pensiones de empleo, obsequio de Navidad, premio de permanencia, así como ayudas para descendientes menores de edad y estudios, anticipos de nómina y préstamos al personal.
Retribución flexible (seguro de salud, restauración, transporte y guardería entre otros).
Consultas de psicología gratuitas. Talleres de bienestar y gimnasio virtual.
Seguro de vida y accidentes.
Formación continua a través de nuestra Universidad Corporativa.
Desarrollo profesional, promoción y movilidad interna a través de nuestros más de 230 centros repartidos por todo el territorio nacional. Política de movilidad internacional.
Acciones para fomentar nuestros valores corporativos.



Requisitos:


Valorable título en Formación Grado Medio, Grado Superior o título universitario en estudios relacionados con la Administración.
Valorable experiencia relacionada con el puesto.
Fecha de incorporación inmediata.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: San Agustín del Guadalix, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Galenicum SAG, empresa farmacéutica ubicada en San Agustín de Guadalix, necesita incorporar al área de Producción, un analista de datos (H/M), con experiencia previa de más de dos años en puestos similares.




Funciones y responsabilidades




Diseñar, implementar y optimizar métodos para la recopilación, tratamiento y análisis de datos, asegurando su integridad y utilidad para la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Analizar los resultados derivados del procesamiento de datos y proponer acciones de mejora orientadas a la eficiencia operativa y la optimización de procesos.
Actuar como interlocutor clave y facilitador en proyectos interdepartamentales, garantizando una comunicación fluida y la alineación de objetivos entre las distintas áreas involucradas.
Recoger, estructurar y priorizar iniciativas de mejora continua provenientes del área de Producción, asegurando su análisis e implementación efectiva.
Supervisar y analizar el indicador OEE de las líneas de acondicionado y máquinas de compresión, difundiendo los resultados y liderando la ejecución de acciones correctivas y de mejora propuestas por jefaturas y responsables operativos.
Realizar análisis mensuales de resultados del área de Producción mediante el seguimiento y evaluación de KPIs, generando informes que respaldan la toma de decisiones.




Formación




Titulación superior en Estadística, Matemáticas, ingeniería industrial o similar
Informática: Nivel avanzado de Microsoft Office, Manejo de SAP, LEAN Manufacturing, Mesbook, Paquete estadístico SPSS, Statgraphics, R Studio.
Inglés: B2




Requisitos




Experiencia mínima de dos años en puestos similares
Se valorará experiencia previa en entornos industriales con actividad ininterrumpida (24/7/365)




Se ofrece contrato indefinido e incorporación en una empresa en pleno crecimiento

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Liferay

Liferay is a uniquely profitable B2B enterprise software company with 1,200+ fiery-eyed employees all across Europe, the Americas, the Middle East, Asia, and Africa. As a renowned provider of enterprise open source technologies, we have been recognized by Gartner for empowering businesses around the world to solve complex digital challenges. Liferay Experience Cloud is an all-in-one solution that unites our Liferay DXP and cloud platform capabilities with built-in analytics and B2B commerce functionality, reducing the time to market and allowing for accelerated innovation - serving notable customers across the globe such as Airbus, US Bank, Honda, and Desjardins.

But we don’t just make awesome software, we are also fueled by a greater-than-profit vision. By building a vibrant business, making technology useful, and investing in communities, we make it possible for people to reach their full potential to serve others. We give our employees five days off to volunteer at charities they’re excited about, and Liferay donates 10% of our profits to charities around the world. Oh, we’re also self-funded which gives us the freedom to work on whatever we think brings the most value to customers and communities in the long run!

About You And This Role

You have that rare ability to bridge two worlds, the human and the technical. You can draw out complex ideas

from stakeholders and distill them into achievable goals. You understand the synergy between requirements

and test plans and are experienced in driving product improvements from requirements gathering till

completion. You like being given the space to run in a global open source company to help deliver creations

that are intuitive and sharp. Sounds like you? Apply now and let’s chat.

Key Objectives


Support data collection efforts by identifying relevant data sources and working with stakeholders to understand their data needs.
Assist in data cleaning, transformation, and preparation for analysis using your SQL techniques.
Perform basic data analysis under guidance, identifying trends and patterns.
Support the creation of clear and informative reports and dashboards to monitor key metrics as well as maintain current dashboards and reports used to support critical business monitoring goals.
Convey insights through both reports, dashboards and visual presentations.
Collaborate with team members and cross functional teams to understand and support ongoing projects.
Assist in the development of self-service tools and internal documentation resources.
Seek opportunities to learn and apply new data analysis techniques and tools.
Contribute to a culture of data-driven decision making.


Required Qualifications


3+ years of work experience in Data Analysis, Business Analysis or relevant experience in analytical tasks or projects working with data.
Experience in working with multiple stakeholders and prioritizing competing requests.
Experience rolling out BI tools/metrics at a global level managing relationships with cross functional teams
Excellent decision-making, critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)
Team player, with strong interpersonal skills and skilled in developing collaborative relationships.
Self-starter, quick learner, detail-oriented and proactive in completing responsibilities.
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact.
Demonstrated experience in data analysis languages as SQL, Python and/or R
Story- telling and visualizing, experience in Tableau or otherBI/Reporting tools


Preferred Qualifications


BA/BS degree in Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar, or 5+ years of equivalent work experience.
Experience with JIRA


What We Offer


Perks: Health Care Plan, food Card, kindergarten Assistance, Gym Membership and an additional perks of your own choice: Transport Card, Office Parking Space, Digital Voucher (800€ annually)
English lessons (2 hours/week)
Hybrid work model
Continuous learning and training: internal and external courses, a technical library, participation in national and international conferences
International, multicultural and diverse environment focused on our people and communities
Working at a leading open source organization with an amazing developer community and customer base


Equal Opportunities Employer - Statement

Liferay is committed to the equal treatment of all candidates, customers and employees and to fostering a culture of dignity at work. Our operating procedure provides for equal opportunities in recruitment and employment with the aim to eliminate discrimination against any job applicant or employee on the basis of race, age, sexual orientation, gender, religion or beliefs, marital or civil partnerships status, family or dependency status, disability, pregnancy and maternity or membership of a traveling community.
Show more

Title: Analista de Dados
HTML:
Na WINNING CONSULTING procuramos um perfil deAnalista de Dadospara se juntar às nossas equipas num projeto de um importante cliente do sector da Saúde, Porto/Lisboa (Híbrido)

REQUISITOS

  • Formação superior em Engenharia Informática, Ciências de Computadores, Sistemas de Informação, ou áreas afins;
  • Experiência comprovada em engenharia de dados ou funções similares (mínimo 1 ano);
  • Sólidos conhecimentos em SQL, modelação dimensional e arquiteturas de Data Warehouse;
  • Experiência com ferramentas de ETL/ELT (ex: Talend, Apache NiFi, Azure Data Factory, SSIS);
  • Conhecimento de bases de dados relacionais (PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Oracle) e tecnologias de Big Data (ex: Hadoop, Spark) será valorizado;
  • Familiaridade com conceitos de data lake, data mesh e cloud (preferencialmente Azure);
  • Domínio de boas práticas de documentação, versionamento de código e CI/CD

Quem Somos?

A Winning Consulting é uma empresa de consultoria que oferece serviços de consultadoria, formação, recrutamento e investigação. Apoiamos os nossos clientes na procura de soluções inovadoras e sustentáveis, desde a aplicação do conhecimento científico na resolução de problemas complexos de gestão até à transformação digital e tecnológica das organizações.

Se quiser saber mais sobre nós, visite o nosso websitehttps://www.winning-consulting.com/

Todas as candidaturas são tratadas com confidencialidade ao abrigo do RGPD.Ao subscreveres a tua candidatura, concordas com o tratamento da tua informação no âmbito do recrutamento e na tua inclusão na nossa base de dados de candidatos.Caso não dês consentimento para o tratamento destes dados, pedimos-te o favor de não te candidatares a este anúncio.

Powered by JazzHR

xT1YWe2Nva

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We are One Team. We make it happen. We are Unstoppable.

A Babel é uma empresa multinacional que fornece serviços tecnológicos orientados para apoiar grandes empresas dos setores da Administração Pública, Banca, Seguros, Indústria e Telecomunicações no seu processo de Transformação Digital.

Estamos em Portugal, Espanha, Marrocos, Colômbia, Costa Rica, República Dominicana, Estados Unidos, Chile, México e Panamá. Uma parte essencial da missão da Babel é oferecer aos colaboradores uma carreira profissional de longa duração, pois acreditamos no trabalho em equipa, nas pessoas e na sua força quando elas combinam a sua paixão com o seu talento.

Nosso plano estratégico

Olhamos para o futuro! O novo plano estratégico Hyperspace 2029 promete ser uma viagem emocionante, cheia de oportunidades para crescer e desenvolver-se profissionalmente. Chegar aos 1000 milhões de faturação, um desafio que estamos confiantes que, com a colaboração e o talento dos nossos colaboradores, será mais uma história de sucesso que escreveremos juntos.

Local de Trabalho:

Formato de trabalho:

Hybrid

Função:

Data Analyst

O que procuramos:

  • Licenciatura ou Mestrado em Engenharia Informática, ou similar;
  • Experiência profissional superior a 5 anos enquanto Data Analyst;
  • Experiência em SQL Server e arquitetura de base de dados MSSQL;
  • Conhecimentos em ferramentas como SSIS, SSMS, SSRS e T-SQL;
  • Experiência na otimização de MSSQL e suporte a HA/DR (Alta Disponibilidade/Recuperação de Desastres);
  • Domínio do Inglês (plus).

#babel

O que oferecemos:

Babel, the great way to achieve the success.

Queres fazer parte de uma equipa em crescimento, empenhada e inovadora que faz história todos os dias? Na Babel, acompanhamos-te no caminho para o sucesso. Acreditamos no talento das pessoas e queremos promovê-lo, oferecendo-te um excelente ambiente de trabalho baseado na colaboração e na solidariedade.

Trabalhar na Babel é muito mais do que trabalhar numa empresa, é juntar-se a uma equipa de pessoas com uma missão partilhada e um modelo de empresa centrado em valores.

Além disso:

  • Carreira profissional e formação contínua;
  • Contrato indeterminado;
  • Remuneração atrativa;
  • Pacote de vantagens sociais à escolha;
  • Equilíbrio entre a vida profissional e pessoal;
  • Sistema de férias inovador;
  • Participação nos lucros da empresa.

Junta-te a nós!

Descobre todas as vantagens de trabalhar na nossa equipa!

https://www.babelgroup.com/pt

https://www.babelgroup.com/pt/personas/valores-de-babel

Em cumprimento com a legislação vigente em matéria de proteção de dados, informamos que o GRUPO BABEL é responsável pelos seus dados pessoais e que os utilizará para levar a cabo processos de recrutamento interno, com base no seu consentimento, mediante o fornecimento dos seus dados curriculares e na aplicação de medidas pré-contratuais. Os dados poderão ser comunicados às entidades que integram o GRUPO BABEL com o objetivo de lhe oferecer o emprego adequado ao seu perfil profissional e aos estabelecidos por lei. Poderá aceder, retificar e eliminar os dados, bem como outros direitos que lhe assistem em matéria de proteção de dados através do site data.protection@babelgroup.com. Mais informações sobre a proteção de dados podem ser consultadas na nossa política de privacidade.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger—and moving faster. We’re a family-founded company on a mission to create the world’s first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018—and now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco—we’ve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you’ll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management—and change lives along the way.

The Role

As a Data Analyst at Air Apps, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to drive business insights and optimize product performance. You will create reports, dashboards, and performance metrics to help teams make informed decisions and improve user experience.

This role requires a data-driven mindset, strong analytical skills, and experience with visualization tools to turn complex data into actionable insights.

Responsibilities


Analyze user behavior, product performance, and key business metrics to identify trends and opportunities.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or Google Data Studio.
Collect, clean, and structure large datasets to ensure accuracy and usability.
Define and track KPIs for marketing, product, and business performance.
Work with SQL, Python, or R to extract, analyze, and manipulate data.
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and marketing teams to provide data-driven insights.
Conduct A/B testing and experiment analysis to improve product features and user engagement.
Identify bottlenecks and opportunities in user journeys and customer funnels.
Present findings in a clear and compelling way to stakeholders and leadership teams.
Stay up to date with industry trends, analytics best practices, and emerging data tools.


Requirements


Around 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Strong analytical skills with experience in Python or R for data analysis.
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
Experience with Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar user analytics tools.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data warehouses (BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).
Familiarity with ETL processes and data pipeline optimization is a plus.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment and manage multiple projects.


What benefits are we offering?


Remote-first approach with flexible working hours.
Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) to support work-life balance.
Annual Bonus.
Top-tier Health Insurance for peace of mind.
Public Transportation Pass to support your commute needs.
Coverflex benefits package for meal allowances, well-being, and more.
Air Conference 2025 in Las Vegas - an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.


Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

Title: Product Data Analyst Trainee | Digital Channels
Description:
Country: Portugal

Location: Lisbon (Hybrid)

About Santander

Santander Bank is a leading global financial institution, dedicated to helping individuals

and businesses prosper. With a presence in over 10 countries, we provide a full range of

banking services, including personal, business, and corporate banking. At Santander,

we’re committed to innovation and continuously improving our digital offerings to meet

the evolving needs of our customers. Our fintech-driven approach emphasizes

leveraging cutting-edge technology to deliver seamless, secure, and personalized

financial experiences.

About The Role

We are looking for a data-driven Product Data Analyst Trainee to join our Digital

Channels team. This role focuses on leveraging data to inform and optimize product

decisions, ensuring our web and app platforms deliver outstanding customer

experiences. The ideal candidate will have basic knowledge of Google Analytics 4 (GA4)

and an analytical background, helping the team with product discovery, business case

development, A/B testing, and the continuous monitoring of key features through

dashboards and reporting tools.

Main Responsibilities


User interaction Analysis: Support in analyzing web and app usage data to uncover


trends, user behavior, and opportunities for product improvement.


Product Discovery Support: Collaborate with Product Managers during the


discovery phase by providing insights from data to identify customer needs and validate

opportunities.


Business Case Development: Contribute to the development of business cases by


providing data-driven insights and projections to evaluate potential product initiatives.


Success Metrics Definition: Partner with stakeholders to define and track key


success metrics for new features and initiatives. Map and define tracking events for key

product metrics (GA4 tagging).


A/B Testing: Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests to validate hypotheses, measure


impact, and optimize product performance.


Dashboard Creation: Help to develop and maintain dashboards for continuous


monitoring of key features, ensuring stakeholders have real-time insights into

performance.


Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers,


Designers, and Marketing teams to ensure data-driven decision-making throughout the

product lifecycle.


GA4 Optimization: Help to ensure best practices are followed on GA4 to maintain


consistency between different conversion funnels

Profile Needed


Experience: Demonstrate interest in data analytics and digital products.
Analytics Expertise: Basic understanding of Google Analytics (GA4 key features), and


of other analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker Studio, Power BI).


Data Storytelling: Ability to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights


and present findings effectively to stakeholders.


Problem-Solving: Strong analytical mindset with a focus on solving complex


problems using data.


A/B Testing: Experience designing and interpreting A/B tests to evaluate product


hypotheses and feature performance.


Collaboration Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with


experience working in cross-functional teams.


Education: Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering,


Mathematics), Economics, Marketing, Business or a related discipline.


Technical Skills: Familiarity with SQL, Python or R for data analysis is a plus. A basic


knowledge or interest of how websites and apps are built (e.g. HTML, CSS, JS) is also valued.

If you’re passionate about data, user behavior, digital products, and making a

meaningful impact in fintech, this is your opportunity to shine. Join Santander’s Digital

Channels team as a Product Data Analyst and help us shape the future of banking with data-driven insights!
Show more

Channels team as a Product Data Analyst and help us shape the future of banking with data-driven insights!

Title: Business Data Analyst – Commercial
Description:
Location

Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2 days a week from the office)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We are seeking a highly skilled Business Data Analyst to join our BI Team, with a dedicated focus on supporting the Commercial Team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, funnel analysis, and commercial performance metrics to deliver actionable insights that drive revenue growth and sales efficiency. You will act as a bridge between data analysis and commercial strategy, enabling data-driven decisions and optimizing commercial operations.

Your Tasks


Act as a dedicated BI partner to the Commercial Team, providing insights to improve sales performance, pipeline management, and revenue generation.
Conduct funnel analysis to understand and optimize the sales process, identifying bottlenecks and areas for improvement.
Analyze sales data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement in sales operations and strategies.
Monitor and report on key sales performance metrics, including pipeline health, win rates, deal velocity, average deal size, etc
Design, develop, and maintain dashboards in Power BI, providing stakeholders with visibility into sales performance and funnel progression.
Use SQL to query and manipulate data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with commercial leaders to identify opportunities for improvement and provide actionable recommendations based on data insights.
Support forecasting efforts by analyzing historical data and trends, enabling accurate revenue projections.
Stay updated on sales trends, tools, and best practices to continuously enhance reporting and analysis.


You Bring


Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Analytics, Marketing, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on B2B SaaS GTM performance and funnel analysis.
Intermediate skills in SQL for querying and analyzing data.
Expertise in Power BI (or similar tools) for creating dashboards, visualizations, and reports.
Strong understanding of sales metrics and KPIs, such as Customer Lifetime Value (CLV), Lead Conversion Rates, and Sales Cycle Length.
Proven experience in conducting and interpreting funnel analysis to optimize sales processes.
Exceptional communication skills to present insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong business acumen with the ability to translate data into actionable recommendations for the sales team.
Experience collaborating with V- and C-level stakeholders, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
Growth mindset and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
High degree of proactivity and self-sufficiency, capable of identifying opportunities and driving insights independently


Why join Usercentrics?


Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we’re happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being


About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths — so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.

Title: Programadores e Estagiários de Informática e Inteligência Artificial
Description:
Descrição da Empresa

Empresa de software com sede em Lisboa e presença internacional admite Programadores e Analistas para reforçar a sua equipa de desenvolvimento.

Perfil do Candidato


Lógica de programação e estrutura de dados
Conhecimentos em pelo menos uma linguagem de programação:


JavaScript, Python, Java ou C#


Conhecimentos de HTML, CSS e conceitos básicos de front-end
Experiência e/ou conhecimento de bases de dados relacionais (como SQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL ou Oracle)
Familiaridade com controlo de versão (Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket)
Noções de desenvolvimento web ou desktop
Noções de utilização de APIs REST
Capacidade de ler e interpretar documentação técnica


Valorizamos Também


Experiência com frameworks/libraries
Conhecimentos de metodologias ágeis (Scrum, Kanban)
Noções básicas de testes (unitários ou funcionais)
Familiaridade com ferramentas de desenvolvimento como VSCode, Postman, Visual Studio ou Docker
Experiência com uso de ferramentas de IA


Contacto

Title: Data Analyst (COO)
Description:
At Axians, we value talent, not labels.

We believe in a culture of inclusion, where everyone has a place and all applications are considered based on merit, without discrimination.

This is your opportunity to join an international group with a project that needs you to help meet the challenges of digital transformation.

💻 THE JOB

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Analyst for a national project.

💡 What We Are Looking For


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus
Fluency in English


⭐ What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360° evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject "DA.RM.DB".

Learn more about Axians

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are: At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.

Who We're Looking For We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Data Analyst with up to 3 years of experience to join our growing team. This role is ideal for someone passionate about turning complex data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making. You will thrive in collaborative environments, demonstrate analytical thinking, and communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. A strong interest in the energy sector and digital behavior analytics will be key to success in this role.

What You'll Do Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support business decisions. Develop and maintain dashboards and interactive reports using Power BI and Looker Studio. Monitor and interpret digital behavior using Google Analytics 4 (GA4). Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to support business strategies with data-driven insights.

Who You Are A data-driven professional with a knack for transforming data into meaningful insights. A collaborative team player with a keen analytical mindset. Eager to grow and contribute to impactful projects in the energy industry. Comfortable communicating complex ideas clearly to varied audiences.

What You'll Need Up to 3 years of experience in data analytics. Proficiency with GA4, Power BI, and Looker Studio (required). Previous experience in the energy sector (required). Familiarity with Google Tag Manager is a plus. Fluency in English (written and spoken). Spanish language skills are a strong plus.

Bonus Points If You Have Experience working in international or multicultural environments. A commitment to continuous learning and skill development. An ability to connect data insights to broader business opportunities. We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we’ve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office an average of four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process. WPP (VML) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn, and X.

When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

Title: DATA ANALYST (HYBRID)
Description:
Portuguese company hires for hybrid work

Location: Lisbon

Work model: Hybrid (2x/week in the office)

Language Requirements: Fluent Portuguese - English (B2 level)

Seniority: Senior (5+ years of experience)

Sector: Energy & Utilities

Instructions: Please send your CVs in English and make sure to include all skills and experience that match the requirements of the opportunity. This will significantly increase your chances of success.

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data modeling, transformation, and visualization, with the ability to collaborate closely with business stakeholders to deliver impactful insights.

Responsibilities


Data Modeling: Design efficient data models and define table relationships optimized for performance.
Data Transformation: Utilize Power Query for cleaning, transforming, and preparing data for analysis.
KPI & Metric Definition: Work collaboratively with stakeholders to define key performance indicators and relevant business metrics.
Report Maintenance: Update and maintain dashboards and reports in line with evolving business requirements.
User Enablement: Provide training to end users and create supporting documentation.
Tool Integration: Integrate Power BI with tools such as Azure, Excel, and SharePoint.
Data Security: Implement and manage row-level security and user permissions.


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Strong expertise in writing SQL queries for data manipulation and performance optimization across multiple database platforms (SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL).
Proficient in Python for developing analytical models, including time series forecasting, K-means clustering, and logistic regression (Logit models).
Advanced knowledge of Power BI, with the ability to create highly interactive dashboards and data visualizations.
Experience using advanced Power BI features such as Drill-through, Slicers, and Bookmarks.
Solid understanding of DAX for complex measures and analytical logic.
Experience with Dremio is a plus.
Fluent in Portuguese and English (written and spoken).

#00300146

Title: Product Data Analyst - Portugal, Europe (Remote)
Description:
Location: Remote, Europe (Bulgaria, Sofia preferred, hybrid possible in our office locations) | Full-time | €44K - 53K

About WebPros

WebPros is committed to empowering businesses worldwide through cutting-edge solutions in web hosting, billing automation, infrastructure, server management, and online marketing. Since our founding in 2017, we’ve rapidly grown into a global leader, expanding our robust portfolio to include industry-defining brands such as cPanel & WHM, Plesk, WHMCS, SolusVM, NIXStats, XOVI, SocialBee, and Sitejet.

Today, we power 85 million+ websites across 900,000+ servers worldwide, backed by a 600+ strong team of dedicated professionals spanning multiple continents. At WebPros, we embrace a fully remote, borderless workplace with a focus on flexibility, autonomy, and work-life balance. Whether you prefer working from a bustling city hub or a quiet home office, we enable our teams to thrive from anywhere while staying deeply connected through our strong collaborative culture.

Your Role

Hi, I’m Bartek, Director SEO & Social Media Marketing Product Portfolio here at WebPros and your future manager. I started my journey by founding a digital agency in my early twenties, which led me into the world of product strategy, growth, and analytics. Over the past 15 years, I’ve helped scale SaaS products to hundreds of thousands of users, led teams across product, development, and marketing, and contributed to building a structured, data-informed culture across WebPros. Today, I focus on driving product success through measurable insights, strong execution, and scalable frameworks—and I’m looking for someone who’s excited to do the same.

We’re now hiring a Product Analyst to help us level up our product analytics and tracking across our global portfolio. This role is all about connecting the dots—from user behavior to product impact—and enabling our teams to make better decisions, faster. You’ll work across four product streams (both SaaS and on-premise), supporting ~20 product managers and collaborating with engineering and data teams. You’ll play a key role in defining meaningful product metrics, helping PMs ask the right questions, and guiding engineers on how to implement clean, actionable tracking.

The biggest challenge in this role? Building a full, end-to-end picture of user activity tracking. That means navigating legal/privacy boundaries, working closely with engineering to ensure quality data flows into Mixpanel and our data warehouse (BigQuery, Redshift, PostgreSQL), and educating PMs on how to choose the right metrics and interpret results. It’s a hands-on role, and we’ll look to you as the go-to expert for product analytics tools like Mixpanel, SQL, and Looker Studio.

You’ll thrive here if you’re comfortable educating others, writing your own queries, structuring metrics from scratch, and collaborating across functions to turn ambiguity into clarity. If you’re the kind of person who gets excited about fixing messy data, documenting tracking plans, and influencing product direction through insight—you’ll fit right in.

You might struggle here if you’re looking for a narrowly scoped analyst role with mature processes already in place. We’re still building the playbook—and you’ll be helping to shape it.

As part of a small and growing product analytics team, you’ll work across ~20 product managers and 4 product streams. While the data engineering team handles broader data ingestion, you’ll sit at the intersection of product and insight—bringing user behavior to the surface so our teams can act on it. And as part of WebPros’ broader product organization, you’ll contribute to shaping how analytics scales across our brands.

This is a hands-on, high-impact role where your ability to translate data into action will directly influence our product direction and customer experience.

Below, you’ll find everything you need to decide if this role is right for you. From our culture and work style to the specifics of the position and hiring process. We believe in transparency, so we’ve put in the effort to give you a real, inside look at what it’s like to work here.

Your Impact In The First 180 Days

We don’t believe in endless checklists of requirements. Instead, here’s what success looks like in your first 6 months:


30 Days: Familiarize yourself with our full product portfolio, from SaaS to on-premise tools. Understand the structure of our four product streams and begin building relationships with product managers, engineers, and data stakeholders. Review and update tracking requirements documentation and assume ownership of Mixpanel communication and implementation support.
60 Days: Take ownership of core product metrics for your assigned product stream(s). Establish tracking processes with product and engineering teams, guide event implementation, and support engineers in implementing tracking specs correctly. Deliver your first post-launch analysis and help PMs identify actionable product insights.
120 Days: Lead in closing key gaps by coaching engineers on clean data implementation and supporting PMs in identifying meaningful metrics and creating data stories. Run end-to-end behavioral analysis for features across multiple product lines. Begin building strategic partnerships with the Data Engineering team to enhance user activity data with broader data lake metrics.
180 Days: Establish yourself as a trusted advisor across multiple product streams. Drive improvements in analytics processes and data documentation, and proactively contribute to team-wide best practices. Influence roadmap decisions, help shape how success is measured across product lines, and start educating PMs and engineers to improve analytics maturity across the product org.


As you grow in this role, you’ll have the opportunity to expand your impact across all four product streams—mentoring others, contributing to analytics tooling decisions, and driving standardization across our tracking and reporting ecosystem.

You’ll Thrive Here If You


You enjoy helping others level up — from defining tracking strategies to coaching others on interpreting data.
Are confident working across multiple product streams, collaborating with 20+ PMs and diverse engineering teams.
Have strong hands-on experience with Mixpanel, including maintaining lexicons, validating implementation, and driving tracking consistency.
Can work end-to-end—from metric definition and SQL-based analysis to visualization in Looker Studio and strategic recommendation.
Are comfortable coaching teams on both the technical (data hygiene) and strategic (product metrics) aspects of analytics.
Communicate clearly in writing and asynchronously across stakeholders in product, engineering, and data.
Thrive in complex environments and enjoy creating clarity out of ambiguity.


You Might Struggle Here If You


Prefer to work on a single product or within a narrowly defined scope.
Need top-down instruction for daily tasks or find it hard to prioritize without a detailed playbook.
Avoid working across legal, engineering, and product to solve messy data problems collaboratively.
Expect clean and centralized data to always be available—some digging and reconciliation is required.
Aren’t comfortable with technical tools like SQL, Redshift, BigQuery, or Mixpanel, or need significant support to operate independently.
Struggle to educate and coach others on the “why” and “how” of good analytics practices.


How We Work


Team & Collaboration: Remote-first and async-friendly setup, embedded within the product org and working closely with Product Managers, Engineers, and the Data team across four product streams.
Team Structure: You’ll be 1 of 3 Product Analysts supporting ~20 Product Managers, working cross-functionally across four product streams with dedicated product and engineering teams.
Communication & Meetings: Clear, structured documentation using Confluence and O365; async-first communication via Slack; minimal, focused meetings held via Teams.
Tooling & Stack: Daily use of SQL, Python, Mixpanel, Google ETL, BigQuery, Redshift, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Looker Studio, and Google Sheets.
Collaboration & Documentation: Jira for planning and tracking; Confluence and Looker dashboards for transparent documentation and sharing of analytical outputs.
Ownership & Autonomy: Analysts own the full workflow — from defining metrics and data requirements to conducting analysis and presenting actionable insights.
Rituals & Process: Weekly team syncs and regular squad rituals ensure alignment, adaptability, and a continuous feedback loop between data and product direction.


Our Culture

WebPros is built on diversity, not just in principle but by design. We’ve grown through acquiring industry-leading brands, bringing together teams from 42+ nationalities, 20+ countries, and 10+ brands. Instead of enforcing a one-size-fits-all culture, we embrace unique perspectives, different working styles, and localized expertise to drive global innovation.

We are a fully remote, async-friendly company where transparency, open communication, and collaborative problem-solving define how we work. Whether you thrive in the fast pace of a startup or the stability of an established product, WebPros offers a dynamic, evolving career journey that you can shape based on your strengths.

We are committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable workplace where every team member feels valued, heard, and supported because our diversity is our strength.

Compensation & Benefits

We believe benefits go beyond just perks. At WebPros, we invest in your growth, flexibility, and well-being, so you can do your best work and build a meaningful career. While we strive to provide equal global benefits for all team members, some may vary by location, and we’ll clarify the details with you during the interview process.


Competitive Salary: €44K - 53K
Remote-first flexibility: Work from anywhere in Europe (or hybrid in available offices).
Health Insurance: public or private coverage, depending on your location.
Paid Time Off: Number of days depending on your location.
Development Budget: Annual personal growth allowance.
Learning Support: Udemy subscription & peer learning.
Public Transport & Meal Vouchers: Location-dependent benefits.
Team Culture: Regular team and on-site company events.


Your Hiring Experience

Hi, I’m Florian, your Talent Partner for EMEA at WebPros. I’ll guide you through the interview process, ensuring a clear, transparent, and meaningful experience. Before moving into talent and culture, I was a software engineer, so I understand what it’s like to navigate technical hiring. My goal is to make this process a genuine, two-way conversation where you feel informed, valued, and empowered to make the best decision for your career.

Hiring is about relationships, not just resumes. You can expect honest, constructive feedback at every step, and I welcome yours as well. No matter the outcome, I want this to be a positive and insightful experience. If you’d like to connect, feel free to reach out on LinkedIn.

Interview Process


Screening Interview (30-45 min): An informal conversation with Florian (Talent Partner) to get to know each other. We’ll explore your background, motivation, and aspirations while giving you a clear overview of WebPros, the team setup, and what to expect from the process. This is your opportunity to ask questions and make sure the role aligns with your career goals.
Hiring Manager Interview (45-60 min): A focused conversation with Bartek (Hiring Manager) to dive deeper into how you approach product analytics, collaboration, ownership, and navigating ambiguity. We’ll also align on your past experience, expectations, and ways of working to assess fit with the team and product area.
Technical & Product Case Interview (60 min): A working session with Bartek and two team members from Product and Data. Together, you’ll walk through a product analytics case, working with a real or hypothetical scenario. This step is designed to evaluate how you break down product questions, work with data, identify insights, and communicate recommendations. We’ll also look at your collaboration style, product intuition, and ability to adapt to imperfect or evolving data environments.
Offer Talk (30 min): A final conversation with Bartek and Florian to walk through the offer, discuss any remaining questions, and ensure mutual clarity on expectations and next steps.


Our Commitment to a Diverse & Inclusive Culture

At WebPros, we want every team member to feel excited to bring their full, authentic self to work. Our strength lies in the diversity of our people, with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences driving innovation and making us stronger together.

We are committed to ensuring equitable opportunities, pay, and support for all employees, regardless of identity, background, or circumstances. We foster a culture of belonging, respect, and psychological safety, where everyone feels valued, heard, and empowered to contribute meaningfully and grow.

Discrimination of any kind, including sexism, racism, xenophobia, homophobia, transphobia, ableism, and ageism, has no place here. By embracing differences and championing inclusivity, we create an environment where everyone can thrive.

We are looking forward to your application!

Best,

Bartek & Florian
