And as part of WebPros’ broader product organization, you’ll contribute to shaping how analytics scales across our brands.

This is a hands-on, high-impact role where your ability to translate data into action will directly influence our product direction and customer experience.

Below, you’ll find everything you need to decide if this role is right for you. From our culture and work style to the specifics of the position and hiring process. We believe in transparency, so we’ve put in the effort to give you a real, inside look at what it’s like to work here.

Your Impact In The First 180 Days

We don’t believe in endless checklists of requirements. Instead, here’s what success looks like in your first 6 months:

  • 30 Days: Familiarize yourself with our full product portfolio, from SaaS to on-premise tools. Understand the structure of our four product streams and begin building relationships with product managers, engineers, and data stakeholders. Review and update tracking requirements documentation and assume ownership of Mixpanel communication and implementation support.
  • 60 Days: Take ownership of core product metrics for your assigned product stream(s). Establish tracking processes with product and engineering teams, guide event implementation, and support engineers in implementing tracking specs correctly. Deliver your first post-launch analysis and help PMs identify actionable product insights.
  • 120 Days: Lead in closing key gaps by coaching engineers on clean data implementation and supporting PMs in identifying meaningful metrics and creating data stories. Run end-to-end behavioral analysis for features across multiple product lines. Begin building strategic partnerships with the Data Engineering team to enhance user activity data with broader data lake metrics.
  • 180 Days: Establish yourself as a trusted advisor across multiple product streams. Drive improvements in analytics processes and data documentation, and proactively contribute to team-wide best practices. Influence roadmap decisions, help shape how success is measured across product lines, and start educating PMs and engineers to improve analytics maturity across the product org.

As you grow in this role, you’ll have the opportunity to expand your impact across all four product streams—mentoring others, contributing to analytics tooling decisions, and driving standardization across our tracking and reporting ecosystem.

You’ll Thrive Here If You

  • You enjoy helping others level up — from defining tracking strategies to coaching others on interpreting data.
  • Are confident working across multiple product streams, collaborating with 20+ PMs and diverse engineering teams.
  • Have strong hands-on experience with Mixpanel, including maintaining lexicons, validating implementation, and driving tracking consistency.
  • Can work end-to-end—from metric definition and SQL-based analysis to visualization in Looker Studio and strategic recommendation.
  • Are comfortable coaching teams on both the technical (data hygiene) and strategic (product metrics) aspects of analytics.
  • Communicate clearly in writing and asynchronously across stakeholders in product, engineering, and data.
  • Thrive in complex environments and enjoy creating clarity out of ambiguity.

You Might Struggle Here If You

  • Prefer to work on a single product or within a narrowly defined scope.
  • Need top-down instruction for daily tasks or find it hard to prioritize without a detailed playbook.
  • Avoid working across legal, engineering, and product to solve messy data problems collaboratively.
  • Expect clean and centralized data to always be available—some digging and reconciliation is required.
  • Aren’t comfortable with technical tools like SQL, Redshift, BigQuery, or Mixpanel, or need significant support to operate independently.
  • Struggle to educate and coach others on the “why” and “how” of good analytics practices.

How We Work

  • Team & Collaboration: Remote-first and async-friendly setup, embedded within the product org and working closely with Product Managers, Engineers, and the Data team across four product streams.
  • Team Structure: You’ll be 1 of 3 Product Analysts supporting ~20 Product Managers, working cross-functionally across four product streams with dedicated product and engineering teams.
  • Communication & Meetings: Clear, structured documentation using Confluence and O365; async-first communication via Slack; minimal, focused meetings held via Teams.
  • Tooling & Stack: Daily use of SQL, Python, Mixpanel, Google ETL, BigQuery, Redshift, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Looker Studio, and Google Sheets.
  • Collaboration & Documentation: Jira for planning and tracking; Confluence and Looker dashboards for transparent documentation and sharing of analytical outputs.
  • Ownership & Autonomy: Analysts own the full workflow — from defining metrics and data requirements to conducting analysis and presenting actionable insights.
  • Rituals & Process: Weekly team syncs and regular squad rituals ensure alignment, adaptability, and a continuous feedback loop between data and product direction.

Our Culture

WebPros is built on diversity, not just in principle but by design. We’ve grown through acquiring industry-leading brands, bringing together teams from 42+ nationalities, 20+ countries, and 10+ brands. Instead of enforcing a one-size-fits-all culture, we embrace unique perspectives, different working styles, and localized expertise to drive global innovation.

We are a fully remote, async-friendly company where transparency, open communication, and collaborative problem-solving define how we work. Whether you thrive in the fast pace of a startup or the stability of an established product, WebPros offers a dynamic, evolving career journey that you can shape based on your strengths.

We are committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable workplace where every team member feels valued, heard, and supported because our diversity is our strength.

Compensation & Benefits

We believe benefits go beyond just perks. At WebPros, we invest in your growth, flexibility, and well-being, so you can do your best work and build a meaningful career. While we strive to provide equal global benefits for all team members, some may vary by location, and we’ll clarify the details with you during the interview process.

  • Competitive Salary: €44K - 53K
  • Remote-first flexibility: Work from anywhere in Europe (or hybrid in available offices).
  • Health Insurance: public or private coverage, depending on your location.
  • Paid Time Off: Number of days depending on your location.
  • Development Budget: Annual personal growth allowance.
  • Learning Support: Udemy subscription & peer learning.
  • Public Transport & Meal Vouchers: Location-dependent benefits.
  • Team Culture: Regular team and on-site company events.

Your Hiring Experience

Hi, I’m Florian, your Talent Partner for EMEA at WebPros. I’ll guide you through the interview process, ensuring a clear, transparent, and meaningful experience. Before moving into talent and culture, I was a software engineer, so I understand what it’s like to navigate technical hiring. My goal is to make this process a genuine, two-way conversation where you feel informed, valued, and empowered to make the best decision for your career.

Hiring is about relationships, not just resumes. You can expect honest, constructive feedback at every step, and I welcome yours as well. No matter the outcome, I want this to be a positive and insightful experience. If you’d like to connect, feel free to reach out on LinkedIn.

Interview Process

  • Screening Interview (30-45 min): An informal conversation with Florian (Talent Partner) to get to know each other. We’ll explore your background, motivation, and aspirations while giving you a clear overview of WebPros, the team setup, and what to expect from the process. This is your opportunity to ask questions and make sure the role aligns with your career goals.
  • Hiring Manager Interview (45-60 min): A focused conversation with Bartek (Hiring Manager) to dive deeper into how you approach product analytics, collaboration, ownership, and navigating ambiguity. We’ll also align on your past experience, expectations, and ways of working to assess fit with the team and product area.
  • Technical & Product Case Interview (60 min): A working session with Bartek and two team members from Product and Data. Together, you’ll walk through a product analytics case, working with a real or hypothetical scenario. This step is designed to evaluate how you break down product questions, work with data, identify insights, and communicate recommendations. We’ll also look at your collaboration style, product intuition, and ability to adapt to imperfect or evolving data environments.
  • Offer Talk (30 min): A final conversation with Bartek and Florian to walk through the offer, discuss any remaining questions, and ensure mutual clarity on expectations and next steps.

Our Commitment to a Diverse & Inclusive Culture

At WebPros, we want every team member to feel excited to bring their full, authentic self to work. Our strength lies in the diversity of our people, with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences driving innovation and making us stronger together.

We are committed to ensuring equitable opportunities, pay, and support for all employees, regardless of identity, background, or circumstances. We foster a culture of belonging, respect, and psychological safety, where everyone feels valued, heard, and empowered to contribute meaningfully and grow.

Discrimination of any kind, including sexism, racism, xenophobia, homophobia, transphobia, ableism, and ageism, has no place here. By embracing differences and championing inclusivity, we create an environment where everyone can thrive.

We are looking forward to your application!

Best,

Bartek & Florian

Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (“RISK MFI”) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (“GM”) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring
The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department
Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and within specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department
There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data
An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key
Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc
The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions
The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues
The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc
The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile and Skills to Success


Master’s Degree in Finance / Mathematics / Science / Engineering or related
At least 2 years of experience in a relevant data analysis field
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in Python
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to synthetise / simplify
Analytical ability
Client focused
Organisational skills
Proactivity


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we’re able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Essential Skills

  • At least 5 years' experience in a similar role;
  • Solid experience in writing SQL queries for data manipulation and performance optimization in databases (SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL);
  • Experience in developing data models;
  • Proficiency in creating interactive visualizations and dashboards (Power BI, DAX);
  • Good knowledge of English.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Intro

At Pleo, we’re on a mission to revolutionise the way businesses manage company spending. No more outdated processes, clunky spreadsheets, or frustrating delays - we believe spend management should be seamless, empowering, and surprisingly effective for finance teams and employees alike. We’re creating tools that promote autonomy, foster trust, and let businesses focus on what truly matters.

Our culture is built on transparency, collaboration, and a deep commitment to innovation – which is reflected in our spending solution. At Pleo, you’ll join a passionate team shaping the future of work, all while having some fun along the way.

About The Role

We're looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Product Analytics Hub at Pleo. In this role, you’ll be partnering closely with product teams across Pleo to unlock value from our rich data to build great products and drive growth. Your insights will directly influence key product decisions, driving significant growth and improving the experience of our customers.

What will you be doing

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will:


Conduct in-depth analysis of user behavior and product performance data to identify key trends, opportunities, and risks, and translate those findings into actionable insights
Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests and other experiments to optimize product features and improve user engagement, ensuring statistical rigor and validity
Identify and deliver scalable methods of providing self-serve product analytics empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions that lead to faster iteration cycles and improved product outcomes
Gain a deep understanding of our customers needs and experiences to identify opportunities to improve customer experience CX
Contribute to identification, development and delivery of data-driven products
Supporting our data governance initiatives, aligning measurement and metrics across business areas domains
Engaging with data colleagues and peers to foster a culture of cross-team learning and knowledge sharing


What you bring

You will thrive in this role if you:


Are an experienced Senior Data Analyst with a strong product analytics background, ideally in a fintech/SaaS company
Possess advanced SQL skills and experience with data modeling tools, particularly dbt and BigQuery
Have deep experience with data visualization tools, specifically Looker and LookML, and product analytics tools such as Amplitude
Have a customer-centric approach to solving business problems, using data to improve customer experience
Have strong statistical knowledge, with experience in experimentation at scale
Are passionate about building high-quality, robust, and user-friendly dashboards and tools for diverse stakeholders
Harness your understanding of business and product strategy, to provide actionable, insightful recommendations
Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for your work, with ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with close attention to detail.


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us for your work days - enjoy catered meals or receive a lunch allowance based on your local office 🍜
Comprehensive private healthcare - depending on your location, coverage options include Vitality, Alan or Médis
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
For our Team, we offer both hybrid and fully remote working options
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We use MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and well-being support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

Intro

No more outdated processes, clunky spreadsheets, or frustrating delays - we believe spend management should be seamless, empowering, and surprisingly effective for finance teams and employees alike. We’re creating tools that promote autonomy, foster trust, and let businesses focus on what truly matters.

Our culture is built on transparency, collaboration, and a deep commitment to innovation – which is reflected in our spending solution. At Pleo, you’ll join a passionate team shaping the future of work, all while having some fun along the way.

About The Role

We're looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Product Analytics Hub at Pleo. In this role, you’ll be partnering closely with product teams across Pleo to unlock value from our rich data to build great products and drive growth. Your insights will directly influence key product decisions, driving significant growth and improving the experience of our customers.

What will you be doing

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will:


Conduct in-depth analysis of user behavior and product performance data to identify key trends, opportunities, and risks, and translate those findings into actionable insights
Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests and other experiments to optimize product features and improve user engagement, ensuring statistical rigor and validity
Identify and deliver scalable methods of providing self-serve product analytics empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions that lead to faster iteration cycles and improved product outcomes
Gain a deep understanding of our customers needs and experiences to identify opportunities to improve customer experience CX
Contribute to identification, development and delivery of data-driven products
Supporting our data governance initiatives, aligning measurement and metrics across business areas domains
Engaging with data colleagues and peers to foster a culture of cross-team learning and knowledge sharing


What you bring

You will thrive in this role if you:


Are an experienced Senior Data Analyst with a strong product analytics background, ideally in a fintech/SaaS company
Possess advanced SQL skills and experience with data modeling tools, particularly dbt and BigQuery
Have deep experience with data visualization tools, specifically Looker and LookML, and product analytics tools such as Amplitude
Have a customer-centric approach to solving business problems, using data to improve customer experience
Have strong statistical knowledge, with experience in experimentation at scale
Are passionate about building high-quality, robust, and user-friendly dashboards and tools for diverse stakeholders
Harness your understanding of business and product strategy, to provide actionable, insightful recommendations
Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for your work, with ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with close attention to detail.


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us for your work days - enjoy catered meals or receive a lunch allowance based on your local office 🍜
Comprehensive private healthcare - depending on your location, coverage options include Vitality, Alan or Médis
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
For our Team, we offer both hybrid and fully remote working options
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We use MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and well-being support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page
Show more

Title: Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The mission of RISK is to provide Senior Management of the Group and of the Operating Divisions, with full transparency and dynamic analysis of the risk and clients managed by Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) and Investment Solutions (IS) business units. RISK contributes to the definition of the Group’s risk appetite, its risk decision-making process and the optimization of capital allocation to support the development of the Operating Divisions
RISK Systems team is part of RISK. Its mission consists in providing the Bank with a comprehensive capital markets risk system used to calculate market and counterparty risk capital figures using advanced methods and to support the needs of users for risk analysis, risk reporting and the credit process. In this context, RISK Systems Operations team is a global team responsible for the production of market and counterparty risk metrics to the RISK function
Operations team is in charge of functional support on market and counterparty risk systems of the bank. The team in Portugal is focusing in particular on the quality aspects of the data that feeds those systems: ensuring data quality issues are resolved, putting in place meaningful Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) about data quality, reviewing and improving existing processes and KPIs, and assisting on the preparation of material for committees where those KPIs are discussed
The mission of Operations team is met by:
Ensuring clients and Senior management have a clear vision of the quality of the services provided by Operation teams, thanks to the production of meaningful KPIs about our main services
Resolution of incidents related to data quality, what regularly involves investigation and coordination with other teams
Running, streamlining, documenting existing processes and improving them once we detect any opportunities to do so
The role is for a position within the Operations team in Lisbon, Portugal


Your Main Activities Are


Work on Data quality aspects, putting in place Key Performance and monitoring Indicators about the availability and quality of the data in our systems, and maintaining these KPIs
Investigate issues detected by those KPIs and help to resolve them permanently
Build close links with risk analysts and other internal RISK Systems clients
Provide training and guidance to new users of the system where required


Profile and Skills to Success


Master’s Degree in Business / Finance / Mathematics / IT or related
Years of relevant experience
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
MS Office Pack (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
SQL
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to deliver / results driven
Organisational skills
Proactivity

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Curator
Description:
Shape the future of innovation, startups & economies

Dealroom is the world’s startup and venture capital database, used by leading teams like Accel, Index, Atomico, Google, Microsoft, AWS, SAP, and 100+ governments, to discover the world’s next generation of transformative companies.

We’re on a mission to accelerate innovation by empowering decision-makers with the most comprehensive data on startups, scaleups, and ecosystems.

Joining Dealroom means working at the confluence of AI, big data, and venture capital and acting as a catalyst at the heart of startup ecosystems. We value relentless client focus, transparency, openness, and candour - the freedom to take risks, admit failures, and speak openly.

About The Data Curation Team

Join our team of data analysts and content curators to improve the quality and accuracy of our data, and to elevate the experience of our users. This role is ideal for team players and problem solvers with an investigative mind looking to enter the world of startups and venture capital. You will develop skills in data quality and classification while expanding your technical toolkit and co-creating scalable solutions. You'll often work directly with our clients.

As a Data Curator, you’ll


Ensure data quality through curation, desk research, classification, content review, and moderation.
Support data operations workflows and assist engineering teams.
Monitor and improve data quality metrics.
Contribute to developing scalable data management solutions.


What You Bring


Academic Credentials: A completed Bachelor's degree in (Business) Information Technology, Finance, Economics, Content Management, or related fields.
Interests: Data and data management tools, from GenAI to Python and BigQuery.
Passion: A demonstrated enthusiasm for technology, startups, and venture capital markets.
Mindset: A proactive, accountable, and urgent approach to work.
Adaptability: Comfort in a fast-paced startup environment where continuous learning, OKRs, ongoing feedback, and curiosity drive success.
Eligibility: Eligibility to work in the EU, residency in the Lisbon area, and fluency in English. Additional language skills are welkom / wilkommen / bienvenido / kyaosopartaal.


What We Bring To The Deal


Ownership: A role where you truly own your work. Show us your capabilities, and we’ll support your growth.
Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy benefits like a laptop of your choice, flexible hours, a fully equipped home office setup, travel allowances, a development budget, weekly workout sessions, and more.
Global & Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse team spanning over 25 nationalities.
Vibrant Workplace: Work in a dynamic environment in the heart of Lisbon (Baixa-Chiado) with flexible hybrid options.
Meritocratic Environment: We value entrepreneurial thinking and are committed to turning innovative ideas into reality.


Ready to accelerate the future of innovation with us? Share your story, and let’s create something transformative together.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We are One Team. We make it happen. We are Unstoppable.

A Babel é uma empresa multinacional que fornece serviços tecnológicos orientados para apoiar grandes empresas dos setores da Administração Pública, Banca, Seguros, Indústria e Telecomunicações no seu processo de Transformação Digital.

Estamos em Portugal, Espanha, Marrocos, Colômbia, Costa Rica, República Dominicana, Estados Unidos, Chile, México e Panamá. Uma parte essencial da missão da Babel é oferecer aos colaboradores uma carreira profissional de longa duração, pois acreditamos no trabalho em equipa, nas pessoas e na sua força quando elas combinam a sua paixão com o seu talento.

Nosso plano estratégico

Olhamos para o futuro! O novo plano estratégico Hyperspace 2029 promete ser uma viagem emocionante, cheia de oportunidades para crescer e desenvolver-se profissionalmente. Chegar aos 1000 milhões de faturação, um desafio que estamos confiantes que, com a colaboração e o talento dos nossos colaboradores, será mais uma história de sucesso que escreveremos juntos.

Local de Trabalho:

Formato de trabalho:

Hybrid

Função:

Data Analyst

O que procuramos:

  • Formação académica em Engenharia Informática, Matemática, Estatística ou área similar;
  • Experiência profissional superior a 3 anos enquanto Data Scientist;
  • Conhecimento avançado das ferramentas Microsoft Office, nomeadamente MS Word, MS Excel e MS PowerPoint;
  • Experiência comprovada com Power BI, SQL e Python;
  • Familiaridade com plataformas de análise e ciência de dados, como Dataiku;
  • Proficiência em Inglês (obrigatório); conhecimentos de Francês são valorizados;

#babel

O que oferecemos:

Babel, the great way to achieve the success.

Queres fazer parte de uma equipa em crescimento, empenhada e inovadora que faz história todos os dias? Na Babel, acompanhamos-te no caminho para o sucesso. Acreditamos no talento das pessoas e queremos promovê-lo, oferecendo-te um excelente ambiente de trabalho baseado na colaboração e na solidariedade.

Trabalhar na Babel é muito mais do que trabalhar numa empresa, é juntar-se a uma equipa de pessoas com uma missão partilhada e um modelo de empresa centrado em valores.

Além disso:

  • Carreira profissional e formação contínua;
  • Contrato indeterminado;
  • Remuneração atrativa;
  • Pacote de vantagens sociais à escolha;
  • Equilíbrio entre a vida profissional e pessoal;
  • Sistema de férias inovador;
  • Participação nos lucros da empresa.

Junta-te a nós!

Descobre todas as vantagens de trabalhar na nossa equipa!

https://www.babelgroup.com/pt

https://www.babelgroup.com/pt/personas/valores-de-babel

Em cumprimento com a legislação vigente em matéria de proteção de dados, informamos que o GRUPO BABEL é responsável pelos seus dados pessoais e que os utilizará para levar a cabo processos de recrutamento interno, com base no seu consentimento, mediante o fornecimento dos seus dados curriculares e na aplicação de medidas pré-contratuais. Os dados poderão ser comunicados às entidades que integram o GRUPO BABEL com o objetivo de lhe oferecer o emprego adequado ao seu perfil profissional e aos estabelecidos por lei. Poderá aceder, retificar e eliminar os dados, bem como outros direitos que lhe assistem em matéria de proteção de dados através do site data.protection@babelgroup.com. Mais informações sobre a proteção de dados podem ser consultadas na nossa política de privacidade.

Title: Internal Auditor - Data Analyst New Joiners
Description:
The Risk Assurance Services area of PwC is dedicated to the analysis and management of business risks, helping organizations strengthen their governance, optimize processes, and comply with regulations. Its objective is to provide security and confidence to stakeholders through audits, evaluation of internal controls, and the use of technology to minimize risks.

In this team, you will deal with complex business challenges and outline strategies for our clients in Portugal and internationally, using technology and data analysis to increase security and optimize the efficiency of companies' processes.

Integrated into the Risk Assurance team, the professional to be hired will have the following main responsibilities:


Conduct internal audits and risk assessments for clients from different sectors
Analyze and optimize processes, ensuring compliance with regulations and best practices
Support the implementation and improvement of internal control systems and corporate governance
Work with data analysis and technology tools to enhance the effectiveness of audit processes
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to develop customized solutions for clients


Curious?

The Risk Assurance Services area of PwC is dedicated to the analysis and management of business risks, helping organizations strengthen their governance, optimize processes, and comply with regulations. Its objective is to provide security and confidence to stakeholders through audits, evaluation of internal controls, and the use of technology to minimize risks.

In this team, you will deal with complex business challenges and outline strategies for our clients in Portugal and internationally, using technology and data analysis to increase security and optimize the efficiency of companies' processes.

Integrated into the Risk Assurance team, the professional to be hired will have the following main responsibilities:

  • Conduct internal audits and risk assessments for clients from different sectors
  • Analyze and optimize processes, ensuring compliance with regulations and best practices
  • Support the implementation and improvement of internal control systems and corporate governance
  • Work with data analysis and technology tools to enhance the effectiveness of audit processes
  • Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to develop customized solutions for clients

Title: Client Services & Data Analyst Internship
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, FX, FI, EQD, Structured Products, Rates, Credits, e-Commerce, Data Analytics, Client Support

Your Main Activities Are

Client Enablement


Responsible for managing and implementing all Client/User Enablement requests to BNP Paribas electronic trading platforms including our Single dealer Platform (Cortex Suites, Smart Derivatives), Multi Dealer platforms such as Bloomberg, Tradeweb, FXall, 360t and FIX API Connections
Relationship with other departments - Sales, Trading and IT Support Teams to manage the configuration of Pricing and Client margin across various platforms


Business Support


Resolve issues across all BNP Paribas electronic products and services, ensuring a quick and effective resolution
Ensure clients are connected, being priced and able to trade at all times
Monitor the status of all systems and electronic trade flows
Using data-mining analysis tools to identify issues
Provide business support to Trading & Sales
Working closely with IT, Credit Risk, Legal, Compliance, etc.


Pricing Configuration


Manage all pricing and tier changes for Sales and Trading in the respective gateways
Manage price controls and limits across all products, ensuring all changes are properly controlled and approved prior to implementation


EBusiness Optimisation


Client Engagement Activities: monitor new client activity as well as dormant clients and users, follow up on credit and limit issues
Conduct client feedback surveys to ensure ECS is meeting customer expectations, improving service levels and product development as needed.
Record all Client Engagement activities in our ecommerce CRM tool to ensure accurate and meaningful MIS around Client Engagement
Constantly review manual process and suggest new operating models to improve efficiency


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Fluency in English
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Python and other IT coding Skills - (Intermediate)


About The Team

Electronic Client Solutions (ECS) is a global team within the COO group, with teams based in London, Lisbon, New York and Singapore, ECS represents the backbone of BNP Paribas's Electronic trading offering.

Its core function is to provide a single point of contact for Client queries for all our Electronic products and services. ECS supports Clients, Trading venues and external counterparties, is responsible for Client enablement, Client Support and vendor relationships across all our Ecommerce platforms.

Responsibilities

ECS supports BNP PARIBAS clients on Single dealer and Multi dealer platforms in conjunction with Sales and Trading. Its responsibilities fall into three main business/product lines organised respectively into three sub-teams:


FX Cash / Options / Algos / Commodities
Fixed Income - Rates / Credit / Structured Products / Derivatives
Structured Products / Derivatives


ECS are a critical component of Electronic Business & Markets group, providing the highest level of service to our external and internal clients to position BNP Paribas as a leading provider of Electronic Markets solutions.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: OutSystems
Description:
Na IRIUMqueremos que persigas sempre os teus sonhos! Aqui, prepara-te para conquistares as tuas metas, enquanto desfrutas do caminho.

Atualmente encontramo-nos à procura deOutSystems

Requisitos:


Experiência:


Mínimo de 4/5 anos de desenvolvimento em OutSystems, incluindo versões Tradicional (maior foco nesta vertente) e Reactive.


Certificações: Certificação OutSystems são um plus. Competências técnicas:


Conhecimento em integrações SOAP e REST;

Conhecimentos sólidos de SQL;

Capacidade de desenhar soluções técnicas;

Capacidade de analisar reports de erro.


Outras Competências: Boa comunicação; Autonomia


Localização:Lisboa,

Regime:Hibrido

O que oferecemos?

➡ Uma empresa inovadora e em crescimento, com muitas oportunidades de desenvolvimento profissional.

➡ Retribuição de acordo com a tua experiência e performance. Acesso a retribuição flexível e seguro médico como benefício social.

➡ Acesso ilimitado a formação tecnológica em modalidade livre.

A IRIUM é uma empresa formada por profissionais dinâmicos e proativos. Os nossos valores são a responsabilidade e o compromisso com a qualidade do trabalho. Este é o espírito que procuramos na IRIUM, seja qual for a tua idade.

Se te reconheces nestes valores, esta é a tua empresa!

Podemos construir juntos o futuro. Falamos?

Title: Analytics Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Flix, we offer a tech-driven environment where innovation meets real-world impact, with competitive pay, strong growth opportunities, and a culture of collaboration and ownership. 

We are trailblazers in data-driven marketing. We firmly believe that successful marketing is rooted in high-quality data, and our commitment to support marketing teams with reliable data solutions is what sets us apart. You will work in a talented team of data engineers, data scientists & a product owner, delivering data products and models that empower marketing teams to take optimal budget steering decisions.

About The Role


Use Python, SQL, and Airflow to design and maintain robust, scalable data pipelines that deliver timely, actionable insights to marketing stakeholders.
Apply analytical thinking to understand complex data requirements and translate them into efficient data pipelines.
Ensure data quality through validation, monitoring, and clear documentation.
Proactively debug and refactor data pipelines to enhance performance, accuracy, and maintainability, based on a solid understanding of the underlying business logic.
Participate in code reviews and contribute to engineering best practices within the team.
Collaborate with the Product Owner and cross-functional teams to understand marketing stakeholders' data needs and translate them into technical solutions.
Assist with ad hoc requests and help resolve data-related issues by applying both technical and analytical problem-solving skills.
Participate in the continuous improvement of data infrastructure by optimizing pipeline performance, enhancing data models, and integrating scalable, future-proof solutions.


About You


You’ve had hands-on experience with Python, SQL, and Git.
You hold a degree in Computer Science or a related field. Candidates from Business or Marketing backgrounds with strong technical experience are also welcome.
You think critically, ask insightful questions, and enjoy turning complex business requirements into clean, effective code.
You are experienced with relational databases and excel at writing complex SQL queries.
You thrive in team settings, communicate well, and are fluent in English.
Bonus: Experience with Airflow, AWS, terraform, CI/CD tools; having worked in Marketing Domain.


We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply. We want to hear from you! 

What We Offer


Travel perks: 12 free Flix vouchers + 12 discount vouchers for friends & family.
Work from (M)Anywhere: Depending on your role, work from another location for up to 60 days per year.
Hybrid work model: We are an office-first company, but we offer flexibility to balance work and life.
Wellbeing support: Access confidential 1:1 counselling, courses, and stress management for yourself and up to four family members.
Learning & Development: Take advantage of language classes, training courses, and expert-led sessions to grow your skills.
Mentoring Program: Connect with experienced colleagues to gain insights and accelerate your career.


To view more local benefits specific to each office location, please check out this link: Locations - Flix Career

Why Join Flix?

At Flix, we empower our teams to push boundaries and shape the future of mobility. As we continue to scale globally, we harness cutting-edge technology to make mobility smarter, more sustainable, and more affordable.

If you’re looking for a place where you can drive change and redefine how millions of people travel, Flix is the place where you can lead your journey!

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Sweatcoin is a mission-driven mobile app, that’s looking to make 1 Billion people more active.

Collectively we’re building a product that has a meaningful, positive impact on the daily lives of our 140M+ customers across the world. Our goal is to inspire a healthier planet by unlocking the value of movement leveraging behavioural science, extrinsic rewards and intrinsic health benefits to get the world physically active.

The most downloaded Health app of the year (2022), having been No.1 Overall App in 56 countries and counting!

If you are interested in solving complex problems, then we are looking forward to seeing you be a part of our team!

About Sweatcoin


A team of exceptional people who celebrate our community by being supportive and creative all the way. All together we’re multiplying each other’s talents which inspire us to develop a product we’re all proud of.
A product that promotes health and fitness in more than 100 countries.
A startup that actually works. We are completely self-sufficient yet our investors are excited to provide us with even more resources to keep growing. We recently broke our record of 10M new users each week.
Cutting-edge technology: our models ensure step verification, preventing any cheating, even by pets earning coins for their owners.
Automatised A/B tests and analytics that is deeply integrated into the product supported by a modern data stack (jupyter, bigquery, airflow, looker)
Diverse and impactful tasks: a variety of projects, from optimizing user experience to creating innovative data solutions, directly impacting millions of users worldwide.
Continuous learning: grow with the team through collaboration on challenging projects and exploring new technologies to expand your skills and improve workflows.


What You Will Do


Work closely with the Product team to analyze and improve product mechanics and user experience.
Conduct deep-dive research to identify product inefficiencies, pain points, and opportunities for improvement, uncover insights and validate hypotheses.
Investigate how users interact with features, detect bottlenecks, and provide actionable recommendations.
Define key product metrics, analyze their fluctuations, and identify underlying drivers.
Design, execute, and interpret A/B tests and experiments to refine product features.
Collaborate with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and QA to support data-driven decision-making.


What We Expect From You


Advanced SQL (window functions, subqueries) and Python (pandas, numpy, sklearn)
Ability to write production-ready code (docker, git, airflow)
Strong foundation in probability theory and mathematical statistics
Knowledge and experience of statistical methods
Product-oriented mindset
Strong attention to detail, ownership and proactive mindset
Excellent English-speaking skills to communicate effectively within the team
Mastery of balancing between self-management and dynamic teamwork
ML experience will be an advantage


What You Get In Return


Remote-friendly & Flexible working hours. The flexibility is incredible, performance is based on output, rather than hours spent working, you can be wherever you want!
Apple devices for work
Team buildings abroad in exciting locations!
Health insurance coverage
WellBeing program, which supports up to 2 counselling sessions per month
Unlimited time-off policy


If you feel that’s a match we would be excited to have you on our team!
Show more

Title: Data Research Consultant (6-Month Contract, Potential to Extend) - Lisbon
Description:
Data Research Consultant (3-Month Contract, Potential to Extend)

Do you have expertise in data for Portugal? Are you familiar with how the real estate and cadastral data processes work? Even better—do you have experience with the telecoms industry or working with municipalities to obtain critical information?

We’re looking for someone passionate about data and problem-solving to join our team as a Data Research Consultant.

This is a 3-month contract role with the potential to extend. Your focus will be:

Providing guidance on navigating ownership processes and related regulations.

Delivering insights and intelligence on real estate, cadastral, and industry-specific data.

Collaborating with our team to source and compile essential information and contacts.

Scaling data effectively to support decision-making and strategic planning.

Knowledge of GIS would be a strong advantage.

Initially, we’re interviewing a wide range of candidates to find the right fit. If this sounds like you, or if you know someone with the right skills and experience, we’d love to hear from you.

Let’s tackle data challenges together. Apply or tag someone who might be a great fit!
Show more
HTML:
Data Research Consultant (3-Month Contract, Potential to Extend)

Do you have expertise in data for Portugal? Are you familiar with how the real estate and cadastral data processes work? Even better—do you have experience with the telecoms industry or working with municipalities to obtain critical information?

We’re looking for someone passionate about data and problem-solving to join our team as a Data Research Consultant.

This is a 3-month contract role with the potential to extend. Your focus will be:

Providing guidance on navigating ownership processes and related regulations.

Delivering insights and intelligence on real estate, cadastral, and industry-specific data.

Collaborating with our team to source and compile essential information and contacts.

Scaling data effectively to support decision-making and strategic planning.

Knowledge of GIS would be a strong advantage.

Initially, we’re interviewing a wide range of candidates to find the right fit. If this sounds like you, or if you know someone with the right skills and experience, we’d love to hear from you.

Let’s tackle data challenges together. Apply or tag someone who might be a great fit!

Title: Data Analyst - Group HR
Description:
About The Job

People Analytics is the AI & Analytics center of expertise for HR. Our goal is to support HR teams in leveraging data to help strategically manage activities and improve employee experience. To achieve this, People Analytics use a AI & Analytics platforms for data processing, visualization and AI. People Analytics offers analyses, dashboards, predictive models, and digital solutions that meet the needs of senior management, HR teams, and business units.

Within People Analytics, you will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in Paris and Lisbon in an agile mode. You will work with other data experts (including data quality analysts, data engineers, data scientists) and will be in constant contact with other HR experts.

As a Data Analyst, you will build analyses and participate in the development of projects that help make strategic decisions for the function (e.g. Analyzing workforce trends for the general management).

Your Main Activities Are

In This Role, Your Missions Will Include

Understand the needs expressed by senior management, HR teams, or the business.

Translate them into an analytical roadmap (scope of analysis, metrics...) to help make decisions.

Develop dashboards (Power BI and Tableau) and written analyses (preparation, exploration, descriptive analysis, data visualization, clustering, machine learning, NLP...) in collaboration with data scientists and data engineers of the team.

Contribute to the monitoring and analysis of workforce trends, from data collection to the delivery of analyses to senior management.

Clearly communicate actionable recommendations orally and in writing through reliable and quality deliverables.

Your Team / Work Environment

This position is to be filled within the People Analytics team at Group HR;

You will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in an agile mode with all the AI&Analytics experts (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, AI Business Analyst, Data project manager, Data Scientist, Data quality analyst, Product Owner…), and will be in contact with other HR department collaborators.

And after? / FUTURE PROSPECTS:

The numerous contacts you will gain will allow you to develop your network and consider joining different teams within GHR or more broadly within the group's businesses.

Profile And Skills To Success

With a scientific background, you have experience as an analyst, management controller, auditor, consultant in a quantitative-oriented position.

Pedagogically, you can communicate your statistical analyses and results clearly and intelligibly to different stakeholders, both in writing and orally, adapting to the technical levels expected by your interlocutors.

You have significant experience in data visualization, data preparation and machine-learning.

Finally, we attach particular importance to our future collaborators acting with responsibility and professional ethics daily.

Your Required Skills

Business Skills:

Data Processing (Expert)

Data Analysis (Expert)

Knowledge of BNP Paribas organization (Proficient)

Knowledge of Human Resources (Proficient)

Knowledge of Data (Proficient)

Data Quality and Security (Expert)

Transversal Skills

Ability to understand, explain, and lead change (Proficient)

Analytical Skills (Expert)

Project Management Skills (Expert)

Ability to lead meetings, seminars, committees and trainings (Proficient)

Ability to define relevant performance indicators (Expert)

Behavioral Skills

Ability to synthesize/simplify (Expert)

Communication Skills – oral and written (Expert)

Adaptability (Proficient)

Results-oriented (Expert)

Problem-solving Skills (Proficient)

Languages

English (Advanced)

Tools / Technologies / Methodologies

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS DataIKU (Proficient)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Proficient)

Python (Proficient)

DATABASE MANAGEMENT Standard SQL (Proficient)

AGILE Methodology (Proficient)

MS OFFICE PACK MICROSOFT EXCEL Tools (Proficient)

Mobility is one of the core principles of BNP Paribas career and management strategy, which aims to meet our Employees’ needs for personal development along with ensuring that the company meets the overall business needs. For further details, we invite you to explore the mobility principles available on https://bwelcome.hr.bnpparibas/internalmobility. Before applying, please make sure you discuss it with your manager whose support is critical

Title: Business Intelligence Data Scientist - Lisbon or Porto
Description:
About The Job


The Business Intelligence Data Scientist’s main mission is to support the industrialization of the Global Banking Transactional Profile Enhancement Program. This Program aims at mapping out all Transaction Banking (TB) products that the clients own within the different Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB) countries, worldwide, into a Power BI dashboard that should be user friendly and easy to navigate, with the goal of providing a clear picture to the Client Relationship Managers of the different products that their clients have in the different geographies


Your Main Activities Are


Collect, clean, and analyze large data sets from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing data quality checks and validation processes
Build pipelines aimed at process automation
Reflect findings in clear data visuals
Identify opportunities for process improvements and recommend data-driven solutions


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Management, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics or any related field
At least 2 years of experience in data analytics and data analysis techniques
Fluency in English
Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools, particularly Excel
Comfortable with Data Visualization tools
Great communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders
Great analytical and ETL skills with eagerness and openness to learn


About The Team


Within CIB, the Transaction Banking business concerns two fundamental business lines
The Cash Management line, which concerns all products that assist our customers with their liquidity needs, such as current accounts, term deposits, payments and collections, forex, among others
The Global Trade Solutions line, which concerns all products that assist our customers with their global trade needs, such as letters of credit, guarantees, supply chain management, factoring, among others

The selected candidate can be based in Lisbon or Porto, according to its preference

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: PL / SQL - ETL DEVELOPER (HÍBRIDO)
Description:
Empresa portuguesa contrata para trabalho híbrido em Portugal

Localização: Porto ou Lisboa - Portugal

Modelo de Trabalho: Híbrido - 2 vezes por semana

Requisitos de Idioma: Português fluente / inglês (diferencial)

Tempo de experiência: Mid 4 a 5 anos de experiência

Setor: Setor Público

Instruções: Por favor, envie seu currículo, e certifique-se de incluir todas as habilidades e experiências que correspondem aos requisitos da oportunidade. Isso aumentará significativamente suas chances de sucesso.

Estamos em busca de um(a) Desenvolvedor(a) PL/SQL Nível Pleno para integrar nossa equipe. O(a) profissional ideal deve ter sólido conhecimento e experiência prática em PL/SQL e processos ETL. Nesta função, você será responsável pela manutenção e desenvolvimento de rotinas corretivas, aplicando sua expertise em bancos de dados Oracle e migração de dados.

Responsabilidades


Extração e transformação de dados em bancos Oracle
Desenvolvimento de scripts em PL/SQL
Realização de migrações de dados
Suporte técnico e funcional
Elaboração de modelos conceituais e modelagem de dados


Requisitos Obrigatórios


Formação superior (concluída ou em andamento) em Engenharia da Computação, Tecnologia da Informação, Ciência de Dados, Estatística, Matemática, Ciência da Computação ou áreas correlatas
Experiência prática de 4 a 5 anos com PL/SQL
Conhecimento em processos ETL
Experiência com ODI (Oracle Data Integrator)
Modelagem de dados
Familiaridade com sistemas operacionais Linux e Windows


Diferenciais


Conhecimento em metodologias ágeis (Scrum/Kanban) e ferramentas como Jira


Ferramentas


Oracle
Jira


Nível de Senioridade


Pleno (4 a 5 anos de experiência)


Idiomas e Habilidades Comportamentais


Inglês (desejável)
Boa comunicação
Espírito de equipe e flexibilidade para colaborar com consultores em diferentes fusos horários
