Title: Data Analyst - RISK BCEF
Description:
About The Job


Within the RISK Portugal Hub of CPBS (Commercial, Personal Banking & Services), you will join the RISK BCEF Reporting team. As a RISK Reporting Data Analyst, you will be responsible for producing BCEF’s RWA (Risk-Weighted Assets) for both monthly and quarterly closings, in cooperation with the RISK BCEF Reporting teams in Paris, BCEF Finance, and Credit Risk Regulatory (CRR) teams in Lisbon. You will also contribute to the production of credit risk reporting and indicators to address increasing regulatory demands and the development of Retail and Corporate securitizations within BCEF
You will be working on various current credit risk and regulatory issues at the heart of banking within the largest entity of CPBS. You will gain a strong understanding of RWA calculations as well as the construction and analysis of key indicators for managing bank’s credit risk. In general, you will develop expertise in credit risk management, banking regulation (CRR3, EBA Guidelines – LOM, NPE-FBE, etc.), and the data challenges within BCEF and RISK BCEF


Your Main Activities Are


During monthly and quarterly financial closings
Production of controls (accounting base, risk parameters EAD/PD/LGD, EL/ELBE shortfall) to critically assess the elements used in capital calculation
Identification of potential anomalies during the capital run and making necessary corrections
Production of dashboards to explain RWA amounts and their variations
Analysis and explanation of results from both an internal and standard approach (following the implementation of Basel 4 in January 2025), including the preparation of presentation materials
Post-financial closings, you will lead work to optimize BCEF’s RWA
Analyze and track the impact of compensations (RISK/Finance discrepancies) to reduce them in collaboration with the Finance teams in Madrid
Analyze risk parameters (freshness of ratings and RTS36 impacts, limiting risk parameters for defaulted items or those subject to management rules)
Contribute to improving the quality of data used (e.g., analyzing collateral, tracking remediation actions on data quality controls (Defensive and RDI controls), participating in the Data Quality Committee (COMET))
Finally, you will also contribute to the production of risk reporting and indicators
Produce and analyze credit risk indicators for recharges or new securitization vehicles to meet internal and regulatory requirements (including the future SLA between RISK BCEF and ALMT)
Produce regular regulatory reports (e.g., Short Term Exercise, Loan Tape CRE) or ad-hoc reports (e.g., BCE requests) in cooperation with the Paris reporting teams

Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science / Mathematics / Statistics or related
At least 5 years of experience in Data Analytics or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Tableau
Power BI
SQL
Ability to deliver / results driven
Ability to manage a project
Ability to synthetise / simplify
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Advanced Analytics Consultant
HTML:
Queres integrar uma das maiores organizações na prestação de serviços profissionais do mercado?

Então a Deloitte é para ti. Aqui, vais ter a possibilidade de potenciar a tua carreira e de reforçar as tuas competências no nosso universo tecnológico.

Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos à procura dos melhores especialistas em Data para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excelência e à nossa comunidade. Na Deloitte, vais transformar o mundo como o conhecemos e desenvolver soluções únicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transformação, de Portugal para o mundo. Vamos reforçar a nossa área de Analytics e procuramos profissionais experientes que tenham gosto e aptidão natural para trabalhar em equipa e em ambiente multi-projeto. Podes descobrir todas as funções que vais desempenhar, de acordo com o teu perfil, para assim dares um salto na tua carreira!

Juntas-te a nós? Estamos à tua espera.

O teu dia a dia e responsabilidades:

  • Planear e executar com autonomia as atividades a realizar na elaboração dos diversos outputs no âmbito de um projeto;
  • Gerir responsavelmente e de acordo com a sua esfera de atuação as relações diárias com o cliente.


És tu quem procuramos?

  • Formação superior nas áreas de Engenharia Informática, Engenharia Eletrotécnica e de Computadores ou similar;
  • Anos de experiência: 2 a 5 anos em consultoria e em Business Intelligence/ Analytics;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos em data mining & Machine Learning;
  • Conhecimentos técnicos em R, Python, SAS Machine Learning e IBM Watson ou ferramentas similares;
  • Conhecimento da língua inglesa no domínio falado e escrito;
  • Conhecimento da língua portuguesa no domínio falado e escrito;
  • Orientação para o cliente e para resultados;
  • Comunicação, relacionamento interpessoal, trabalho em equipa e colaboração;
  • Resolução de problemas, capacidade analítica e espírito crítico;
  • Organização, planeamento e orientação para a qualidade dos projetos;
  • Orientação para o cliente e para resultados;
  • Residência em Portugal obrigatória.


Desenvolve uma carreira à tua medida

  • Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos;
  • Através de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades técnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão e impacto relevante nesta área de especialização;
  • Acesso ilimitado às maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy);
  • Oportunidade de formações e certificações nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud.


Vive uma cultura de união

  • Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e precursores de tendências;
  • Um ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade;
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas;
  • Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, inovação, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.


Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte nunca trabalharás sozinho. Terás a oportunidade de integrar diversos projetos de transformação e fazer parte de uma equipa que te vai inspirar e ajudar a desenvolver soluções diferenciadoras, num ambiente dinâmico e colaborativo, onde podes dar o melhor de ti e beneficiar das nossas iniciativas de bem-estar e flexibilidade. Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Braga, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnológicos em Braga. Além disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal têm projeção internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte liderança global em low code/no code, em engenharia de redes de telecomunicações, em plataformas tecnológicas de transformação organizacional (ServiceNow e Apptio) e na indústria de serviços financeiros (Finastra, TIA e Guidewire).

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas competências nalguma destas áreas em soluções tecnológicas – engenharia de software, cloud, integração de sistemas, data analytics & data science, cyber risk, engenharia de redes telecomunicações, UX design - e gostarias de trabalhar com tecnologias como AWS, Google, Oracle, Salesforce, SAP, Mulesoft, Feedzai e SAS, entre outras, então estás no lugar certo!

Keywords: Sobre a Deloitte; Technology; Consulting; Anos de Experiência

Title: Survey Associate
Description:
Every day, somewhere in the world, important decisions are made. Whether it is a private equity company deciding to invest millions into a business or a large corporation implementing a new strategic direction, these decisions impact employees, customers, and other stakeholders. 

Consulting and private equity firms come to proSapient when they need to discover knowledge to help them make great decisions and succeed in their goals. It is our mission to support them in their discovery of knowledge. 

We help our clients find industry experts who can provide their knowledge via interview or survey: we curate this knowledge in a market-leading software platform; and we help clients surface knowledge they already have through expansive knowledge management.  

As a Survey Associate, your primary responsibility will be to source and vet subject-matter experts from across the globe to participate in client surveys. Having understood the client brief, you'll identify the most relevant professionals—leveraging both our AI-driven expert platform and utilising professional networking sites and other online resources to ensure each survey has the highest-quality participants.

This is a high-impact, fast-paced role with significant exposure to senior stakeholders within the business. You'll also have the opportunity to contribute to defining what best-in-class survey sourcing looks like as we scale this function within the business.

What You Will Do as an Associate


Receive and understand client briefs that cover a wide range of industries, markets, and regions.
Source relevant experts globally using our proprietary platform, and other external recruiting tools
Evaluate expert profiles through pre-screening questions, screening calls where necessary and background research to assess fit for the survey
Communicate directly with experts to confirm authenticity, relevance, and willingness to participate
Maximize conversion from sourced profiles to completed survey responses to ensure client deadlines are met
Update and maintain expert data in our core platform, ensuring accuracy and relevance of information.
Collaborate with team members to exceed client expectations and continuously improve project delivery
Contribute to shaping survey sourcing practices and identifying opportunities for process or product innovation



Requirements


A Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in a market research, business-related or analytical field
Proactive, results-driven mindset with a focus on generating value for clients
Strong problem-solving skills to identify and resolve any problems which arise in a timely and effective manner, at times when no precedent or process exists
Strong communication skills to speak clearly and take a constructive approach when in pressurised situations, working collaboratively with other stakeholders to find solutions, whether clients, experts, vendors or fellow team members
The organisational and time management skills required to handle multiple projects simultaneously, effectively managing your own time and priorities
Confidence and tenacity to thrive in a performance-based environment
Collaborative team player who's also comfortable working independently, working with integrity and always looking to set fellow team members up for success
Adaptability and drive, working in a rapidly growing environment with ongoing process development and structural evolution, delivering a consistently high quality of work and service
Reflective and always willing to take onboard feedback and learn
Bonus: experience sourcing participants for quantitative market research



Benefits


Tenure gifts to thank our loyal staff who help the business to grow 
An enhanced Maternity & Paternity package 
22 days annual leave each year + Statutory public holidays, inclusive of a week's closure over the Christmas period to fully reset 
A paid sick leave policy (up to 10 days per year) 
A hybrid working model featuring three days per week in the Lisbon office and 2 from home 
Meal allowance of 9.6€ per working day. 
Full health insurance through AdvanceCare (Once passed probationary period)
Team socials - from Pizza to Caribbean to Korean food, we love to encourage our team to get together and try new experiences together! 
The opportunity to create, lead or participate in one of our many ERG groups, to help drive diversity, inclusion and understanding across our business 
Corporate Events: from bi-annual Christmas & Summer parties, we love to celebrate, collaborate and have fun together! 

We are committed to building an inclusive workplace - did you know that marginalized groups are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every requirement listed? If you are interested in the above role, but don't necessarily tick every box, we encourage you to apply anyway - this role could still be a great match!  

At proSapient, we are an equal opportunity employer. As such, we offer equal employment opportunities without regard to race, colour, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status and other protected class characteristics.  

All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need. Due to the regulated nature of our clients, all successfully offered candidates are subjected to thorough screening & pre-employment checks, including an enhanced background check, which can affect the outcome of any offer of employment.

Title: Product Analyst - ComparaJá
Description:
About us

Our mission is to help consumers save time and money by matching them with the best products for their banking, insurance, and utility needs. We work towards becoming the largest distributor of financial services. ComparaJá.pt is part of Samlino Group (https://samlinogroup.com/). We operate across five markets, empowering users reach healthier financial lives.

What we offer you

You'll have the unique opportunity to be a key driver of our exponential growth curve. In your daily work, you will work directly with our Founder and senior teams.

Sunny Lisbon will be your home base, but you'll travel between our five markets (Portugal, Denmark, Belgium, Finland and Greece)!

Your Responsibilities

You will be accountable for your own projects and will be responsible for driving results across various ventures and initiatives. Your responsibilities in this job will evolve and be defined and redefined throughout your time with us. The aim is to take ownership of and drive the development of progressively larger opportunities.

What we expect from you

We are looking for a dynamic individual who thrives in a results-oriented environment to join our team and help us reach our objectives. Industry experience is not a requirement, but you do need to be highly ambitious, proactive, forward-thinking, a fast learner, and driven to succeed.

Furthermore, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a proactive mindset, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and possess a track record of successfully owning projects from conception to completion
Possess an unwavering drive and desire to be the very best at what they do
Are passionate about making an impact and driving tangible results
Exude a strong work ethic fueled by an urgency to progress
Embrace ownership and proactively follow through on commitments
Possess an insatiable curiosity about business, data, and people, relishing the opportunity to build and nurture relationships that fuel lasting success
Master communication, wielding words with impact both verbally and in writing
Showcase unrivalled organisational skills, skillfully structuring and prioritising their work to achieve maximum efficiency
Native proficiency in either Portuguese or Danish and fluent in English
EU work permit is required


Start date and Location

Flexible start date

This role is full-time onsite at our Lisbon office

Title: Data Engineering Intern
Description:
About Unbabel

The company’s language operations platform blends advanced artificial intelligence with human editors, for fast, efficient, high-quality translations that get smarter over time. Unbabel integrates seamlessly in any channel so that agents can deliver consistent multilingual support from within their existing workflows. Making it easy for enterprises to grow into new markets and build seamless customer experiences in every corner of the world.

Based in San Francisco, California, Unbabel works with leading customer support and marketing teams at brands such as Facebook, Microsoft, Booking.com, and Under Armour to communicate effortlessly with customers around the world, no matter what language they speak.

What’s the opportunity about?

Unbabel is looking for a Data Engineering Intern to join our team. As a Data Engineering Intern, you’ll help design, build, and maintain the data infrastructure and pipelines that support Unbabel’s core products and analytics. This is a unique opportunity to learn how large-scale language and translation data is processed, stored, and analyzed in a real-world, production environment.

Key Details:


📍 Location: Hybrid in Lisbon (at least 2x per week in the office)
⏳ Duration: 6 months
💶 Salary: €1,000/month gross
🗣️ Working language: English


Responsibilities


Collaborate with data engineers and other technical teams to understand business requirements and deliver data solutions.
Assist in building, testing, and maintaining data pipelines (extraction, transformation, loading—ETL) and data integrations.
Help optimize the performance and reliability of our data workflows.
Contribute to the documentation of data architecture, pipelines, and processes.
Learn to work with structured and unstructured data from multiple sources.
Support data quality efforts—including monitoring, testing, and validation.
Participate in daily team standups, sprint planning, and code reviews.
Grow your skills in modern data tools, programming, and cloud technologies.


Requirements


Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Software Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Basic programming skills—preferably Python (or similar language).
Interest in data engineering, databases, cloud services, or big data.
Understanding of fundamental data structures and concepts (e.g. tables, schemas, SQL or basic database querying).
Curiosity and willingness to learn best practices in data engineering, data processing, and analytics.
Ability to communicate in English and work collaboratively in a team.
Eagerness to ask questions, seek feedback, and grow as an engineer.


Nice to Have


Exposure to data pipeline tools or frameworks (e.g., Airflow, dbt, Luigi).
Understanding of cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
Experience with data visualization or reporting (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).


Benefits


Professional Growth and Impact Opportunities: Hands-on experience working with large-scale, real-world data in a production environment. Learn modern data engineering workflows and cloud data platforms with supportive mentors.
Flexible Working hours: At Unbabel, working hours are flexible. You can adjust them as it best suits you and your work needs.
Parking Spots: The office has a garage with 20 parking spaces for any Unbabeler to use. It works in a “first-come, first-served” way.
Mental Health Support: An 'in-house' psychologist to support the mental well-being of all Unbabelers.
Daily Breakfast: Every day from 8h30 am to 10h30 am, a small breakfast buffet is served in Tower Lisbon’s kitchen area.
Dog-friendly Office: Dogs are welcome in our office. Just be aware that the dog must be sociable with humans and other dogs, and well behaved.


What to expect from our interview process?


Interview with Recruiter
Technical Interview with 2 Engineers
Interview with 2 Engineering Managers
Interview with VP of Engineering


Diversity Statement

Unbabel is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, colour, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, or mental disability. Not only do we not discriminate, but we celebrate differences. The positions open at Unbabel are also intended for people with disabilities under DL no. 4/2019. If for whatever reason you need us to make reasonable adjustments and adaptations to our recruitment process, please let your recruiter know.

(We are not accepting candidates coming from recruitment agencies at this moment)

Title: DATA ENGINEER / SQL AND PYTHON (HYBRID)
Description:
Portuguese company hires for hybrid work

Working Model: Hybrid (once a month at the office);

Seniority: Senior

Location: Lisbon / Portugal

Language Requirements: Portuguese (minimum C2) / English (B2)

Sector: Pharma

Instructions: Please send your CVs in English and make sure to include all skills and experience that match the requirements of the opportunity. This will significantly increase your chances of success.

We're hiring a Senior Data Engineer. Join a leading company in the pharmaceutical sector as a Senior Data Engineer, working with Databricks, PySpark, Azure Data Factory, and modern data architecture. This role is ideal for professionals passionate about building scalable data pipelines and ensuring data quality and reliability.


Your Role As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing and delivering scalable and efficient data pipelines using Databricks, PySpark, Python, and Azure Data Factory. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, enhance data models, and ensure the reliability, scalability, and compliance of the platform. Your responsibilities will also include troubleshooting issues, optimizing existing systems, and supporting data applications in alignment with ITIL standards.


📍 Candidates must be based in Portugal and available to work from the Lisbon office at least once a month.


Your Profile
Proven experience in data engineering with a strong focus on Databricks, PySpark, and Azure Data Factory
Proficient in SQL and Python
Hands-on experience with Azure cloud services and working with APIs
Solid understanding of data warehousing and data modeling best practices
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills and a team-oriented mindset
Commitment to quality and continuous improvement


#00301461

  • Proven experience in data engineering with a strong focus on Databricks, PySpark, and Azure Data Factory
  • Proficient in SQL and Python
  • Hands-on experience with Azure cloud services and working with APIs
  • Solid understanding of data warehousing and data modeling best practices
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication skills and a team-oriented mindset
  • Commitment to quality and continuous improvement

#00301461

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
HTML:
Requirements

Noesis is looking for candidates with the following profile:

  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar;
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in Business Intelligence Development;
  • Experience in Python, SQL and Spark.
  • Ability to develop complex applications;
  • Good knowledge of Databricks and the Azure ecosystem (Data Factory, Function Apps and ADLS);
  • Experience in DevOps methodology and CI/CD tools (GitHub, GitHub Actions);
  • Client-oriented, dynamic and problem-solving attitude;
  • High levels of curiosity, multitasking, proactivity and self-motivation.

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

Title: Power Platform Expert
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum’s team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum’s solutions aim at contributing to its clients’ performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

Are you passionate about building cutting-edge solutions with Microsoft Power Platform? At Inetum, we’re looking for a skilled and experienced Power Platform Expert to join our dynamic team and help drive digital transformation for our clients.

Qualifications

We’re seeking a professional with:


✅ 5+ years of experience developing solutions using Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI)
✅ Proven expertise in solution architecture with a focus on Power Platform, Dataverse, and Microsoft ecosystem integration (Azure, Dynamics 365, SharePoint)
✅ Advanced knowledge of Power Apps (Canvas and Model-Driven)
✅ Mastery of Power Automate, including complex flows, premium connectors, and external API integration
✅ Strong experience with Dataverse, data modeling, and RBAC security
✅ Familiarity with ALM, managed solutions, pipelines, and DevOps for Power Platform
✅ Understanding of governance and DLP best practices
✅ Skills in JavaScript, Power Fx, and C# (a plus!)
✅ PL-600 or PL-400 certification (a strong advantage)
✅ Fluency in English
✅ Availability to work from our Porto or Lisbon offices when needed
✅ Interest in exploring AI Agents and emerging technologies
Show more

Title: Senior Full Stack Data Analyst
Description:
Intro

At Pleo, we’re on a mission to revolutionise the way businesses manage company spending. No more outdated processes, clunky spreadsheets, or frustrating delays - we believe spend management should be seamless, empowering, and surprisingly effective for finance teams and employees alike. We’re creating tools that promote autonomy, foster trust, and let businesses focus on what truly matters.

Our culture is built on transparency, collaboration, and a deep commitment to innovation – which is reflected in our spending solution. At Pleo, you’ll join a passionate team shaping the future of work, all while having some fun along the way.

About The Role

We're looking for a Senior Full Stack Data Analyst to join our growing analytics team. You’ll be partnering closely with product teams across Pleo to unlock value from our rich data to build great products and drive growth. Your data expertise & insight generations will directly influence key product decisions, driving significant growth and improving the experience of our customers.

What will you be doing

As a Senior Full Stack Data Analyst, you will:


Building end-to-end analytics solutions, using data modelling, analytics techniques and data visualisation to power Pleo
Conduct in-depth analysis of user behavior and product performance data to identify key trends, opportunities, and risks, and translate those findings into actionable insights
Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests and other experiments to optimize product features and improve user engagement, ensuring statistical rigor and validity
Identify and deliver scalable methods of providing self-serve product analytics empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions that lead to faster iteration cycles and improved product outcomes
Contribute to identification, development and delivery of data-driven products
Engaging with data colleagues and peers to foster a culture of cross-team learning and knowledge sharing


What you bring

You will thrive in this role if you:


Are an experienced data practitioner with a dual background in analytics and analytics engineering within a fast-paced environment, preferably fintech
Possess expert technical skills and experience with tools such as advanced SQL, dbt, BigQuery, Looker (and LookML)
Have a customer-centric approach to solving business problems, using data to improve customer experience
Are passionate about building high-quality, robust, and user-friendly dashboards and tools for diverse stakeholders
Like to be involved in both engineering excellent products and understanding business and product challenges with analytics.
Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for your work, with ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with close attention to detail
Are highly familiar with CI/CD processes and understand their importance in maintaining data integrity


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, and London offices, or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets 🍜
Private health insurance to ensure you’re fit in body and mind to do your best work
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
Flexibility/remote working options
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We’re trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page
Show more

Title: Personal Data Protection Analyst
Description:
At Axians, we value talent, not labels.

We believe in a culture of inclusion, where everyone has a place and all applications are considered based on merit, without discrimination.

This is your opportunity to join an international group with a project that needs you to help meet the challenges of digital transformation.

💻 THE JOB

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Personal Data Protection Analyst for a national project.

💡 What We Are Looking For


+5 years of experience in similar roles, including significant experience on Data Privacy / GDPR;
Mandatory experience / academic background on EU GDPR;
Full proficiency of MSOffice suite;
Proficiency of Project Management tools and methodologies;
Knowledge of other Privacy laws and regulations is a plus;
Fluency in English (written & spoken).


⭐ What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360° evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject "PDPA.IB.DB".

Learn more about Axians
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Queres integrar uma das maiores organizações na prestação de serviços profissionais do mercado?

Então a Deloitte é para ti. Aqui, vais ter a possibilidade de potenciar a tua carreira e de reforçar as tuas competências no nosso universo tecnológico.

Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos à procura dos melhores especialistas em Data para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excelência e à nossa comunidade. Na Deloitte, vais transformar o mundo como o conhecemos e desenvolver soluções únicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transformação, de Portugal para o mundo. Vamos reforçar a nossa área de Data&AI, que tem suportado milhares de clientes na evolução/criação das suas plataformas de dados, analítica e IA e, por isso, procuramos profissionais experientes que tenham gosto e aptidão natural para trabalhar em equipa e em ambiente multi-projeto. Podes descobrir todas as funções que vais desempenhar, de acordo com o teu perfil, para assim dares um salto na tua carreira!

Juntas-te a nós? Estamos à tua espera.

O teu dia a dia será composto por vários desafios, dos quais podemos elencar alguns:

  • Desenho e implementação de Arquiteturas de Dados escaláveis utilizando tecnologias de ponta com um foco na Cloud (Azure, GCP, AWS, Alibaba Cloud);
  • Extrair, transformar e carregar (ETL) grandes volumes de dados de diversas fontes para Datalakes e Data Warehouses;
  • Definição e implementação de processos para controlo e tratamento de dados (Data Quality, Profiling, Cleansing, Masking, entre outros);
  • Desenho e implementação de soluções real-time;
  • Colaborar com vários stakeholders em projetos nacionais e internacionais;
  • Colaborar com múltiplos colegas da rede Deloitte, tirando partido do conhecimento e projetos internacionais que já decorreram e que estão a decorrer;
  • Assumir gradualmente a coordenação de equipas técnicas e funcionais no âmbito de projetos de dados;
  • Propor novas ideias e criar provas de conceito para diferentes desafios.


Procuramos profissionais com algumas das valências abaixo:

  • Licenciatura/ Mestrado nas áreas de Engenharia Informática, Engenharia Eletrotécnica e de Computadores, Matemática ou áreas similares;
  • Experiência profissional entre 1 e 6 anos em projetos de Data;
  • Conhecimento de processos de desenvolvimento de software;
  • Conhecimentos de SQL / NoSQL;
  • Experiência profissional em soluções ETL (exemplos: Azure Data Fabric, AWS Glue, FiveTran, DBT, Talend, Matillion, Databricks);
  • Conhecimentos em Python, PySpark;
  • Experiência em soluções da Data Visualization (exemplo: Power BI, Tableau, Microstrategy, Looker, Grafana, Qlik);
  • Valorizamos experiência profissional com Data Warehouses / Data Lakes / Data Lakehouses;
  • Conhecimento de soluções Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP, Alibaba Cloud) orientadas a arquiteturas de dados distribuídos;
  • Valorizamos experiência profissional em soluções/tecnologias Real-time (exemplos, Kafka, Apache Flink, Apache Spark, Amazon Kinesis, Azure Data Stream, MongoDB, outras);
  • Valorizamos experiência previa em projetos com metodologias Agile;
  • Domínio da língua inglesa falado e escrito (obrigatório);
  • Valorizamos também profissionais que tenham conhecimentos de língua francesa e alemã.
  • Valorizamos certificações orientadas aos projetos de dados;
  • Orientação para o cliente e para resultados;
  • Boas capacidades de comunicação, relacionamento interpessoal e trabalho em equipa;
  • Sentido de responsabilidade, sentido crítico, curiosidade.


Desenvolve uma carreira à tua medida

  • Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos;
  • Através de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades técnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos;
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão e impacto relevante nesta área de especialização;
  • Acesso ilimitado às maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy);
  • Oportunidade de formações e certificações nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud.


Vive uma cultura de união

  • Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e precursores de tendências;
  • Um ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade;
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas;
  • Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, inovação, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.


Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte nunca trabalharás sozinho. Terás a oportunidade de integrar diversos projetos de transformação e fazer parte de uma equipa que te vai inspirar e ajudar a desenvolver soluções diferenciadoras, num ambiente dinâmico e colaborativo, onde podes dar o melhor de ti e beneficiar das nossas iniciativas de bem-estar e flexibilidade. Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Braga, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnológicos em Braga. Além disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal têm projeção internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte liderança global em low code/no code, em engenharia de redes de telecomunicações, em plataformas tecnológicas de transformação organizacional (ServiceNow e Apptio) e na indústria de serviços financeiros (Finastra, TIA e Guidewire).

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas competências nalguma destas áreas em soluções tecnológicas – engenharia de software, cloud, integração de sistemas, data analytics & data science, cyber risk, engenharia de redes telecomunicações, UX design - e gostarias de trabalhar com tecnologias como AWS, Google, Oracle, Salesforce, SAP, Mulesoft, Feedzai e SAS, entre outras, então estás no lugar certo!

Sabe mais em www.deloitte.com/pt/careers .

Keywords : Sobre a Deloitte; Consulting; Technology

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Us

Indie Campers, the go-to campervan Marketplace, is on a mission of making road trips available to everyone. Thanks to its digital approach and customer-centric orientation, Indie Campers has developed a strong booking experience and high-quality road trips at affordable prices.

With over one million nights rented through our travel platform, we have welcomed more than 300,000 travelers from 169 countries. We offer a comprehensive and expanding array of road trip possibilities: short-term RV rentals, long-term campervan subscriptions, and the possibility of buying one of our vehicles available for sale.

Rooted in a deep technological focus, our challenges are both exciting and demanding and require top talent and motivation to be successfully pursued. We are growing our team and looking for those interested in pursuing this dream with us and joining an ever-developing journey.

THE ROLE

As Indie Campers Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building Indie Campers systems for data collection, management, and conversion, turning raw data into usable information for our Data team and various Business Stakeholders to use.

You’ll be developing the data pipelines and systems that power Indie Campers’ data-driven business and enable the future-looking features we’re currently developing powered by big data and AI.

You will join our Global Data team in our Lisbon HQ, report directly to our Data Lead, and work closely with Engineering, Product, Marketing, Revenue, and Operations teams.

WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?

Role

As a Data Engineer at IndieCampers, you will play a key role in shaping the future of our Data and AI capabilities. Working alongside a team of talented experts, you will:


Design, build, and maintain efficient and scalable data pipelines.
Develop innovative tools and frameworks to enhance the data platform.
Foster a data-driven culture across the company.
Collaborate closely with data scientists and analysts to deliver actionable insights, forecasts, and optimization strategies.
Establish and maintain data quality standards across the organization.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?


5+ years of experience in Data Engineering.
Proficiency in relational and non-relational databases including PGSQL, MongoDB, BigQuery, Redshift ;
Familiarity with a technology stack that includes experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Redis, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Chef, and Terraform.
Familiar with modern architecture and engineering best practices: microservices, CI/CD, infrastructure-as-code, monitoring, incident response
Experience with first-hand principles and trade-offs of software engineering, like algorithms, concurrency, asynchronous & reactive processing, distributed systems. Strong understanding of computer science fundamentals such as algorithms, asynchronous & multi-threaded processes
Prior experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, QuickSight, Metabase, Power BI);Experience working in with or implementing data pipelines, from ingestion to serving, with technologies such as Kafka, Postgres, S3 / GCS, Spark, and Databricks/Snowflake.

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
Job Openings

Product Analyst

Product - Lisboa, Lisboa (Hybrid)

Department

Product

Employment Type

Full-Time

Minimum Experience

Mid-level

About UpHill Health

At UpHill, we’re on a mission to revolutionize healthcare. By developing best-practice clinical pathways and care orchestration software, we help healthcare providers and life sciences companies across Europe streamline their processes, eliminate inefficiencies, increase care coordination, and improve patient outcomes — all while creating more capacity for health systems and driving revenue growth.

We’re not just another healthtech company; we have built the most compliance-ready care orchestration solution in Europe. We’re a team of innovators who push boundaries, take ownership, and strive for excellence. If you’re excited about making a real impact, growing alongside passionate colleagues, and tackling meaningful challenges, you just might be an Uphiller.

Your Role: Product Analyst

Are you passionate about data-driven decision-making and transforming healthcare? As a Product Analyst at UpHill, you’ll be at the heart of our product development process—analyzing user needs, optimizing business processes, and enhancing the functionality of our solutions. Your insights will directly shape our products and drive impact in the healthcare sector.

What You’ll Do


Dive deep into data—conduct in-depth analyses to uncover insights and trends that drive product strategy.
Craft compelling reports on product performance, market trends, and customer needs.
Define clear, actionable specifications for new features and enhancements.
Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure our products align with business goals and user expectations.
Leverage research methodologies (A/B testing, data modeling) to drive evidence-based decisions.
Take full ownership of projects and ensure long-term success beyond launch.


What We’re Looking For


Degree in Business, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience in product analysis or a similar role in tech or healthcare.
Strong analytical mindset with the ability to work with large datasets.
Excellent communication & collaboration skills—you can translate complex data into actionable insights.
Structured & detail-oriented approach to problem-solving.
Impact-driven mindset—you thrive in a fast-paced, high-impact environment.


Bonus Points for


Experience with data analysis tools or SQL or Python.
Knowledge of healthcare IT systems & software (e.g., JIRA).
Ability to write user stories, BDD, and acceptance criteria.
Strong technical writing & documentation skills.
Experience with Agile methodologies & project management.
A curious, creative, and proactive mindset.


What You’ll Get


Be part of a dynamic, mission-driven team shaping the future of healthcare
Competitive salary
Flexible work options
Comprehensive health insurance
Top-tier equipment – New PC + budget for peripherals
No BS culture


Ready to shape the future of healthcare with us? Apply now and become an Uphiller!

Title: Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
Job Description



The Infrastructure Engineer is responsible for the end-to-end management of IT infrastructure, covering both cloud-based and on-premises environments. This role ensures the stability, security, and scalability of critical systems and services, contributing directly to business continuity and service reliability. The engineer will work closely with cross-functional teams to design, implement, monitor, and enhance infrastructure solutions that support modern application delivery and enterprise operations.



Key Responsibilities:



Infrastructure Design & Implementation:

Design, deploy, and maintain scalable, secure, and high-performing IT infrastructure solutions across cloud and on-premises environments, aligned with business and technical requirements.



Collaboration with Development Teams:

Work closely with software development and DevOps teams to ensure infrastructure is optimized for efficient, reliable, and secure application deployment and lifecycle management.



System Monitoring & Performance Optimization:

Monitor infrastructure health and performance, proactively identifying and resolving issues to ensure high availability, disaster recovery readiness, and service continuity.



Maintenance & Support:

Provide ongoing support, incident resolution, system upgrades, and enhancements to existing infrastructure components including servers, networks, databases, and storage systems.



Security & Compliance:

Implement and maintain robust security practices, ensuring compliance with internal policies and industry standards, including access controls, patch management, and data protection measures.



Technology Evaluation & Innovation:

Continuously research and evaluate emerging technologies, tools, and methodologies to drive innovation and efficiency across infrastructure operations.



Reporting & Documentation:

Provide regular updates to management on system performance, incident metrics, infrastructure improvements, and risk mitigation strategies. Maintain accurate documentation of infrastructure configurations and procedures.







This is a hybrid position, requiring 2 days per week in the office located in Olaias, Lisbon.

Fluency in both Portuguese and English is required for effective communication with local and international teams.





Qualifications



The ideal candidate for the Infrastructure Engineer role brings a combination of technical expertise, problem-solving ability, and strong communication skills. We are looking for professionals who either possess the following competencies or are actively developing them:



Solid hands-on experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform, as well as on-premises infrastructure built on Linux and Windows environments.



Strong knowledge of networking fundamentals, including TCP/IP, VLANs, VPNs, firewalls, routing, and switching.



Proficiency in virtualization and containerization technologies such as VMware, Hyper-V, Kubernetes, and Docker.



Experience with infrastructure automation and scripting using tools like PowerShell, Python, Bash, Terraform, and Ansible.



Understanding of backup and disaster recovery strategies, with exposure to tools such as Datto, as well as cloud-based and on-premises backup solutions.



Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills to identify and resolve complex infrastructure issues.



A proactive mindset focused on continuous improvement and adaptability in fast-paced, evolving environments.



Working knowledge of cybersecurity principles, industry best practices, and regulatory compliance (e.g., GDPR, ISO 27001).



Experience with security tools, vulnerability management, and threat mitigation strategies.



Ability to ensure secure configurations and maintain compliance across systems and platforms.



Effective verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly document infrastructure processes, solutions, and technical guidelines.



Comfortable working both independently and as part of cross-functional teams.



Ability to train and support team members on tools and practices within the area of responsibility.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Flix, we offer a tech-driven environment where innovation meets real-world impact, with competitive pay, strong growth opportunities, and a culture of collaboration and ownership. 

We are trailblazers in data-driven marketing. We firmly believe that successful marketing is rooted in high-quality data, and our commitment to support marketing teams with reliable data solutions is what sets us apart. You will work in a talented team of data engineers, data scientists & a product owner, delivering data products and models that empower marketing teams to take optimal budget steering decisions.

About The Role


Use Python, SQL, and Airflow to design and maintain robust, scalable data pipelines that deliver timely, actionable insights to marketing stakeholders.
Apply analytical thinking to understand complex data requirements and translate them into efficient data pipelines.
Ensure data quality through validation, monitoring, and clear documentation.
Proactively debug and refactor data pipelines to enhance performance, accuracy, and maintainability, based on a solid understanding of the underlying business logic.
Participate in code reviews and contribute to engineering best practices within the team.
Collaborate with the Product Owner and cross-functional teams to understand marketing stakeholders' data needs and translate them into technical solutions.
Assist with ad hoc requests and help resolve data-related issues by applying both technical and analytical problem-solving skills.
Participate in the continuous improvement of data infrastructure by optimizing pipeline performance, enhancing data models, and integrating scalable, future-proof solutions.


About You


You’ve had hands-on experience with Python, SQL, and Git.
You hold a degree in Computer Science or a related field. Candidates from Business or Marketing backgrounds with strong technical experience are also welcome.
You think critically, ask insightful questions, and enjoy turning complex business requirements into clean, effective code.
You are experienced with relational databases and excel at writing complex SQL queries.
You thrive in team settings, communicate well, and are fluent in English.
Bonus: Experience with Airflow, AWS, terraform, CI/CD tools; having worked in Marketing Domain.


We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply. We want to hear from you! 

What We Offer


Travel perks: 12 free Flix vouchers + 12 discount vouchers for friends & family.
Work from (M)Anywhere: Depending on your role, work from another location for up to 60 days per year.
Hybrid work model: We are an office-first company, but we offer flexibility to balance work and life.
Wellbeing support: Access confidential 1:1 counselling, courses, and stress management for yourself and up to four family members.
Learning & Development: Take advantage of language classes, training courses, and expert-led sessions to grow your skills.
Mentoring Program: Connect with experienced colleagues to gain insights and accelerate your career.


To view more local benefits specific to each office location, please check out this link: Locations - Flix Career

Why Join Flix?

At Flix, we empower our teams to push boundaries and shape the future of mobility. As we continue to scale globally, we harness cutting-edge technology to make mobility smarter, more sustainable, and more affordable.

If you’re looking for a place where you can drive change and redefine how millions of people travel, Flix is the place where you can lead your journey!
Show more

If you’re looking for a place where you can drive change and redefine how millions of people travel, Flix is the place where you can lead your journey!

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
We are One Team. We make it happen. We are Unstoppable.

A Babel é uma empresa multinacional que fornece serviços tecnológicos orientados para apoiar grandes empresas dos setores da Administração Pública, Banca, Seguros, Indústria e Telecomunicações no seu processo de Transformação Digital.

Estamos em Portugal, Espanha, Marrocos, Colômbia, Costa Rica, República Dominicana, Estados Unidos, Chile, México e Panamá. Uma parte essencial da missão da Babel é oferecer aos colaboradores uma carreira profissional de longa duração, pois acreditamos no trabalho em equipa, nas pessoas e na sua força quando elas combinam a sua paixão com o seu talento.

Nosso plano estratégico

Olhamos para o futuro! O novo plano estratégico Hyperspace 2029 promete ser uma viagem emocionante, cheia de oportunidades para crescer e desenvolver-se profissionalmente. Chegar aos 1000 milhões de faturação, um desafio que estamos confiantes que, com a colaboração e o talento dos nossos colaboradores, será mais uma história de sucesso que escreveremos juntos.

Local de Trabalho:

Formato de trabalho:

Hybrid

Função:

Data Scientist

O que procuramos:

  • Licenciatura ou Mestrado em Engenharia Informática, ou similar;
  • Experiência profissional superior a 1 ano como Data Scientist;
  • Experiência com bases de dados relacionais e NoSQL;
  • Experiência no desenvolvimento de projetos de machine learning (Python, R ou SAS), e de soluções analíticas que envolvam IA;
  • Conhecimentos da metodologia Agile, e ferramentas Jira e Confluence (valorizados);
  • Fluência em Inglês (obrigatório) e Espanhol (valorizado).

#babel

O que oferecemos:

Babel, the great way to achieve the success.

Queres fazer parte de uma equipa em crescimento, empenhada e inovadora que faz história todos os dias? Na Babel, acompanhamos-te no caminho para o sucesso. Acreditamos no talento das pessoas e queremos promovê-lo, oferecendo-te um excelente ambiente de trabalho baseado na colaboração e na solidariedade.

Trabalhar na Babel é muito mais do que trabalhar numa empresa, é juntar-se a uma equipa de pessoas com uma missão partilhada e um modelo de empresa centrado em valores.

Além disso:

  • Carreira profissional e formação contínua;
  • Contrato indeterminado;
  • Remuneração atrativa;
  • Pacote de vantagens sociais à escolha;
  • Equilíbrio entre a vida profissional e pessoal;
  • Sistema de férias inovador;
  • Participação nos lucros da empresa.

Junta-te a nós!

Descobre todas as vantagens de trabalhar na nossa equipa!

https://www.babelgroup.com/pt

https://www.babelgroup.com/pt/personas/valores-de-babel

Em cumprimento com a legislação vigente em matéria de proteção de dados, informamos que o GRUPO BABEL é responsável pelos seus dados pessoais e que os utilizará para levar a cabo processos de recrutamento interno, com base no seu consentimento, mediante o fornecimento dos seus dados curriculares e na aplicação de medidas pré-contratuais. Os dados poderão ser comunicados às entidades que integram o GRUPO BABEL com o objetivo de lhe oferecer o emprego adequado ao seu perfil profissional e aos estabelecidos por lei. Poderá aceder, retificar e eliminar os dados, bem como outros direitos que lhe assistem em matéria de proteção de dados através do site data.protection@babelgroup.com. Mais informações sobre a proteção de dados podem ser consultadas na nossa política de privacidade.

Title: Business Systems Analyst – Data Visualization & Procurement Analytics
Description:
Join our team at AMGEN Capability Center Portugal, number 1 company in Best Workplaces - https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/ - ranking in

Portugal (category 201-500 employees) by the Great Place to Work Institute. We have a team of over 400 talented people and more than 38

different nationalities, diverse areas of expertise and professional experience that are shaping the future of healthcare. This is your chance to

explore a world of opportunities in different areas such as Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, Digital, Technology and Innovation, Finance,

General & Admin, Human Resources, Regulatory Affairs and many more. In Lisbon's city center, our AMGEN office fosters innovation,

excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in

people’s lives.

BUSINESS ANALYST

LIVE

What You Will Do

Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role, you will serve as a Business Systems Analyst supporting data analytics and visualization efforts across Amgen’s Global Procurement Operations. You will work with Product Owners, Data Engineers, and Business SMEs to deliver reporting and dashboards that unlock insights across Source-to-Settle processes. This role is critical to building Amgen’s analytics foundation for procurement transformation.

Roles & Responsibilities:


Capture and document business reporting and analytics requirements across product teams.
Design and build dashboards in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or ReactJS.
Translate procurement KPIs into actionable visualizations aligned with product team priorities.
Collaborate with EDF and source system teams (SAP, Ariba, Apex, LevelPath) to define and access data sources.
Perform data validation and user acceptance testing for new dashboards and enhancements.
Enable self-service analytics capabilities for business users.
Develop and maintain data models, data dictionaries, and other documentation to ensure data accuracy and consistency
Implement data security and privacy measures to protect sensitive data
Ensure compliance with Amgen’s data governance and visualization standards.


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Basic Qualifications and Experience:


Master’s degree and 5+ years of relevant experience OR
Bachelor’s degree and 8+ years of relevant experience OR
Diploma and 12+ years of professional experience.


Must-Have Skills:


Hands-on experience with Tableau, Power BI, and ReactJS.
Solid understanding of procurement data and Source-to-Settle processes.
Strong design and UX skills, including experience with wireframing, prototyping, and user flow mapping using tools like Figma
Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and Scala for data processing and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) workflows, with hands-on experience in using Databricks for building ETL pipelines and handling big data processing
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with relational (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) databases.
Experienced with software engineering best-practices, including but not limited to version control (GitLab, Subversion, etc.), CI/CD (Jenkins, GitLab etc.), automated unit testing, and Dev Ops
Ability to partner with cross-functional stakeholders to define KPIs and reporting needs.


Good-to-Have Skills:


Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS particularly in data services (e.g., EKS, EC2, S3, EMR, RDS, Redshift/Spectrum, Lambda, Glue, Athena)
Solid understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and data integration concepts
Understanding of machine learning pipelines and frameworks for ML/AI models


Professional Certifications (Preferred):


Tableau or Power BI certification; Agile certifications are a plus.


Soft Skills:


Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to collaborate across global teams and influence outcomes.
Strong organizational skills to handle multiple priorities.
Team-oriented and focused on delivering high-value solutions.
Self-starter with a proactive approach to resolving challenges and driving innovation.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
A diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth, and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

CAREERS.AMGEN.COM

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: OPC Reporting and Automation - Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The Global Markets Operational and Permanent Control (GM OPC) set-up faces increasing Regulatory and Conduct demands beyond pure Operational Risk. As part of Strategy Conduct and Risk (SCR), GM OPC operates over the 3 main regions, through the three following Practices:


Regulatory Practice: support any regulatory requirement with a sustainable framework, in line with the dedicated Governance, Control Plan & Risk Assessment
Conduct Practice: assess and challenge the effectiveness of the Conduct control set-up as well as ensure a full convergence between Conduct Risk Identification (CRI), Risk and Control Self-Assessment – RCSA).
Operational Risk Practice: contribute to protect the business (P&L, reputation)


The three Practices are further supported by three transversal Streams – Protection (Management and monitoring of incidents, remediation actions and recommendations), Prevention (Deploying RCSA and contribute to Operational risk computation) and Supervision (Validation process and Coordinating the internal control Governance and other Regulatory-based committees).

Your Main Activities Are


Support the team to produce regular reporting on the main operational risk indicators, and proactively suggest improvements on the reports;
Use different tools to collect and analyze data, as well as structuring queries and performing routine maintenance of reports;
Perform trend analysis comparison to previous weeks/months/quarters
Proactively suggest improvements on reports on a continuous basis and promote digital solutions
Ensure data input & quality check;
Support the execution of governance committees and presentations
Support the OPC team with Ad-Hoc requests (Statistics; Kpis; presentations; etc.)
Liaise & Interact with OPC teams worldwide


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor, Post-Graduation or Master Degree in Data Science; Management, Finance, Science, Maths;
Excellent knowledge of PowerPoint, Excel, VBA, Power BI, (other languages would be a plus)
Analytical and quantitative skills, Precision, rigorousness;
Excellent organizational skills
Team spirit, ability to work with others;
Ability to communicate clearly in both oral and written form (English);
Experience in investment banking is an advantage.


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Role Overview

We are seeking a talented and experienced Data Engineer to join our growing data team. In this role, you will be instrumental in building, maintaining, and optimizing our data infrastructure, with a strong emphasis on DataOps principles. You will work closely with data analysts, and other engineers to ensure the reliability, scalability, and security of our data pipelines.

Key Responsibilities


Translate the business requirements into technical specifications, in cooperation with the data product owner.
Design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable data pipelines using Airflow.
Utilize dbt for data transformation and modeling, ensuring data quality and consistency.
Employ Terraform for infrastructure as code (IaC), automating the provisioning and management of our data infrastructure.
Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines for data engineering workflows.
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline performance, identifying and resolving bottlenecks.
Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Contribute to the development of data engineering best practices and standards.
Manage and maintain data repositories using Git.
Automate data-related tasks to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort.
Cooperate with the support teams and provide L3 support to comply with predefined SLA’s


Key Qualifications


University degree in computer science, engineering, or comparable field.
3-5 years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
Experience with data warehousing concepts and technologies.
Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) data services (e.g., BigQuery, Cloud Storage)
Knowledge of dbt and version management tools (e.g. Git).
Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) using Terraform.
Experience with workflow orchestration tools such as Airflow.
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with CI/CD pipelines.
Experience working with SAP platforms as data sources (e.g., SAP ECC, SAP S/4HANA, SAP BW, SAP Datasphere).
Knowledge of SAP data structures and extraction methods.
Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g. Looker).
Scrum methodology.
